VMware NSX for vSphere 6.2.4 API Guide

Introduction

This manual, the NSX for vSphere API Guide, describes how to install, configure, monitor, and maintain the VMware® NSX system by using REST API requests.

Intended Audience

This manual is intended for anyone who wants to use REST API to programmatically control NSX in a VMware vSphere environment. The information in this manual is written for experienced developers who are familiar with virtual machine technology, virtualized datacenter operations, and REST APIs. This manual also assumes familiarity with NSX for vSphere.

VMware Technical Publications Glossary

VMware Technical Publications provides a glossary of terms that might be unfamiliar to you. For definitions of terms as they are used in VMware technical documentation go to http://www.vmware.com/support/pubs.

Document Feedback

VMware welcomes your suggestions for improving our documentation. If you have comments, send your feedback to docfeedback@vmware.com.

NSX Documentation

The following documents comprise the NSX documentation set:

  • NSX for vSphere Administration Guide
  • NSX for vSphere Installation and Upgrade
  • NSX API Programming Guide

Technical Support and Education Resources

The following sections describe the technical support resources available to you. To access the current version of this book and other books, go to http://www.vmware.com/support/pubs.

Online and Telephone Support

To use online support to submit technical support requests, view your product and contract information, and register your products, go to http://www.vmware.com/support.

Customers with appropriate support contracts should use telephone support for the fastest response on priority 1 issues. Go to http://www.vmware.com/support/phone_support.

Support Offerings

To find out how VMware support offerings can help meet your business needs, go to http://www.vmware.com/support/services.

VMware Professional Services

VMware Education Services courses offer extensive hands‐on labs, case study examples, and course materials designed to be used as on‐the‐job reference tools. Courses are available onsite, in the classroom, and live online. For onsite pilot programs and implementation best practices, VMware Consulting Services provides offerings to help you assess, plan, build, and manage your virtual environment. To access information about education classes, certification programs, and consulting services, go to http://www.vmware.com/services.

Ports Required for the NSX REST API

The NSX Manager requires port 443/TCP for REST API requests.

Security Schemes

Basic Authentication basic

Endpoints

https://{nsxmanager}/api

URI Parameters

nsxmanager string required

This is the hostname or IP address of the NSX Manager

/1.0/appliance-management

Working with Appliance Manager

/1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backup

On-demand backup

POST /1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backup

Backup NSX data on-demand

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backups

Retrieve list of all backups available at configured backup location

GET /1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backups

Retrieve list of all backups available at configured backup location

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backupsettings

Appliance Manager backup settings

GET /1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backupsettings

Retrieve backup settings

Security

  • basic

PUT /1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backupsettings

Configure backup on the Appliance Manager

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="backupRestoreSettings">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="ftpSettings">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="transferProtocol"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostNameIPAddress"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="backupDirectory"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="filenamePrefix"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passiveMode"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="useEPRT"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="useEPSV"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="backupFrequency">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="frequency"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dayOfWeek"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hourOfDay"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="minuteOfHour"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="excludeTables">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="excludeTable"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<backupRestoreSettings>
  <ftpSettings>
    <transferProtocol></transferProtocol>
    <hostNameIPAddress></hostNameIPAddress>
    <port></port>
    <userName></userName>
    <password></password>
    <backupDirectory></backupDirectory>
    <filenamePrefix></filenamePrefix>
    <passiveMode></passiveMode>
    <useEPRT></useEPRT>
    <useEPSV></useEPSV>
  </ftpSettings>
  <backupFrequency>
    <frequency></frequency>
    <dayOfWeek></dayOfWeek>
    <hourOfDay></hourOfDay>
    <minuteOfHour></minuteOfHour>
  </backupFrequency>
  <excludeTables>
    <excludeTable></excludeTable>
  </excludeTables>
</backupRestoreSettings>

DELETE /1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backupsettings

Delete Appliance Manager backup configuration

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/restore

Restore data from a backup file

POST /1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/restore

Restore data from a backup file

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

restoreFile string required

file name of restore file

/1.0/appliance-management/certificatemanager/certificates/nsx

NSX Manager certificate manager

GET /1.0/appliance-management/certificatemanager/certificates/nsx

Query the certificate thumbprint from a NSX manager

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/components

Components management

GET /1.0/appliance-management/components

Retrieve all Appliance Manager components

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/components/{componentID}

Specified component ID

GET /1.0/appliance-management/components/{componentID}

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/components/{componentID}/dependencies

Component dependencies

Retrieve dependency details for specified component

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/components/{componentID}/dependents

Component dependents

GET /1.0/appliance-management/components/{componentID}/dependents

Retrieve dependents for the specified component

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/components/{componentID}/status

Component status

GET /1.0/appliance-management/components/{componentID}/status

Retrieve current status for specified component

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/global/info

Global appliance manager information

GET /1.0/appliance-management/global/info

Retrieve global information containing version information as well as current logged in user

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/notifications

Working with support notifications

GET /1.0/appliance-management/notifications

Retrieve all system generated notifications

Security

  • basic

DELETE /1.0/appliance-management/notifications

Delete all notifications

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/notifications/{ID}/acknowledge

Acknowledge a notification

URI Parameters

ID string required

Notification ID

POST /1.0/appliance-management/notifications/{ID}/acknowledge

Acknowledge a notification

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/status/{componentID}

Query upgrade status

URI Parameters

componentID string required

Component ID

GET /1.0/appliance-management/status/{componentID}

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/summary/components

Component information

GET /1.0/appliance-management/summary/components

Retrieve summary of all available components and their status info

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/summary/system

Summary appliance manager information

GET /1.0/appliance-management/summary/system

Retrieve system summary info such as address, dns name, version, CPU, memory and storage

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/system/cpuinfo

CPU Info

GET /1.0/appliance-management/system/cpuinfo

Query CPU information

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/system/locale

Configure locale

GET /1.0/appliance-management/system/locale

Retrieve locale info

Security

  • basic

PUT /1.0/appliance-management/system/locale

Configure locale

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="locale">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="language"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="country"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<locale>
  <language></language>
  <country></country>
</locale>

/1.0/appliance-management/system/meminfo

Appliance Manager memory

GET /1.0/appliance-management/system/meminfo

Query memory

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/system/network

Working with network settings

GET /1.0/appliance-management/system/network

Retrieve network information i.e. host name, IP address, DNS settings

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/system/network/dns

Configure DNS

PUT /1.0/appliance-management/system/network/dns

Configure DNS

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="dns">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipv4Address"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipv6Address"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="domainList"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<dns>
  <ipv4Address></ipv4Address>
  <ipv6Address></ipv6Address>
  <domainList></domainList>
</dns>

DELETE /1.0/appliance-management/system/network/dns

Delete DNS servers

Security

  • basic

POST /1.0/appliance-management/system/restart

Reboot the appliance manager

Security

  • basic

Appliance Manager storage

GET /1.0/appliance-management/system/storageinfo

Query storage

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/system/syslogserver

Working with syslog servers

GET /1.0/appliance-management/system/syslogserver

Retrieve syslog servers

Security

  • basic

PUT /1.0/appliance-management/system/syslogserver

Configure syslog servers

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="syslogserver">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="syslogServer"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="protocol"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<syslogserver>
  <syslogServer></syslogServer>
  <port></port>
  <protocol></protocol>
</syslogserver>

DELETE /1.0/appliance-management/system/syslogserver

Delete syslog servers

Security

  • basic

/1.0/appliance-management/system/timesettings

Working with time settings

GET /1.0/appliance-management/system/timesettings

Retrieve time settings

Security

  • basic

PUT /1.0/appliance-management/system/timesettings

Configure time or specify the NTP server to use for time synchronization

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="timeSettings">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="ntpServer">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="string"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="datetime"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="timezone"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<timeSettings>
  <ntpServer>
    <string></string>
  </ntpServer>
  <datetime></datetime>
  <timezone></timezone>
</timeSettings>

/1.0/appliance-management/system/timesettings/ntp

/1.0/directory/directory/listLdapServersForDomain/{domainID}

domainID string required

Specified domain

GET /1.0/directory/directory/listLdapServersForDomain/{domainID}

Query LDAP servers for a domain

Security

  • basic

/1.0/directory/directory/updateEventLogServer

EventLog server

POST /1.0/directory/directory/updateEventLogServer

Create EventLog server

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="EventlogServer">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="domainId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<EventlogServer>
  <id></id>
  <domainId></domainId>
  <hostName></hostName>
  <enabled></enabled>
</EventlogServer>

/1.0/directory/directory/updateLdapServer

Create LDAP server

POST /1.0/directory/directory/updateLdapServer

Create LDAP server

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="LDAPServer">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="domainId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<LDAPServer>
  <domainId></domainId>
  <hostName></hostName>
  <enabled></enabled>
</LDAPServer>

Security

  • basic

/1.0/directory/updateDomain

Working with domains

POST /1.0/directory/updateDomain

Register or update a domain with NSX Manager

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="DirectoryDomain">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="netbiosName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="username"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<DirectoryDomain>
  <name></name>
  <type></type>
  <netbiosName></netbiosName>
  <username></username>
  <password></password>
</DirectoryDomain>

/1.0/eventcontrol

eventControl Operations

/1.0/eventcontrol/config/vm/{vmID}

Retrieve per vm configuration for data collection

URI Parameters

vmID string required

MOID of the guest vm

GET /1.0/eventcontrol/config/vm/{vmID}

Retrieve per vm configuration for data collection

Security

  • basic

/1.0/eventcontrol/eventcontrol-root/request

Data collection kill switch on/off

POST /1.0/eventcontrol/eventcontrol-root/request

Turn on/off data collection at global level

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="request">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="actions">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="action">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<request>
  <actions>
    <action>
      <type></type>
      <value></value>
    </action>
  </actions>
</request>

/1.0/eventcontrol/vm/{vmID}/request

Enable or disable data collection on a virtual machine

URI Parameters

vmID string required

MOID of the guest vm

POST /1.0/eventcontrol/vm/{vmID}/request

Enable or disable data collection on a virtual machine

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="perVmConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="actions">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="action">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<perVmConfig>
  <actions>
    <action>
      <type></type>
      <value></value>
    </action>
  </actions>
</perVmConfig>

/1.0/identity/userIpMapping

Query user-to-ip mapping list from database

GET /1.0/identity/userIpMapping

Query user-to-ip mapping list from database

Security

  • basic

/1.0/nsx/cli

Working with the Central CLI

POST /1.0/nsx/cli

The central command-line interface (central CLI) commands are run from the NSX Manager command line, and retrieve information from the NSX Manager and other devices. These commands can also be executed in the API.

You can insert any valid Central CLI command as the command parameter. For a complete list of the Central CLI commands executable through the API, please see the Central CLI chapter of the NSX Command Line Interface Reference.

Security

  • basic

Request Headers

Accept string required

Specify text/plain.

Query Parameters

suffix string required

Use action=execute.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="nsxcli">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="command"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<nsxcli>
  <command>show logical-switch list host host-21 vni</command>
</nsxcli>

/1.0/sam/syslog

Working with Activity Monitoring syslog support

/1.0/sam/syslog/disable

Disable syslog support

POST /1.0/sam/syslog/disable

Disable syslog support

Security

  • basic

/1.0/sam/syslog/enable

Enable syslog support

POST /1.0/sam/syslog/enable

Enable syslog support

Security

  • basic

/2.0/auditlog

Get NSX Manager audit logs

GET /2.0/auditlog

Get NSX Manager audit logs

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

startIndex string

The starting point for returning results.

pageSize string

The number of results to return. Range is 1-1024.

/2.0/dlp

Configuring Data Security

/2.0/dlp/classificationvalue

Classification values associated with regulations

GET /2.0/dlp/classificationvalue

Get all classification values

Security

  • basic

/2.0/dlp/completedscansummaries

Retrieve start and end time, total number of vm's scanned, and total number of violations for the last five completed data security scans

GET /2.0/dlp/completedscansummaries

Retrieve scan summaries

Security

  • basic

/2.0/dlp/excludableareas

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="FileFilters">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="scanAllFiles"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="lastModifiedAfter"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extensionsIncluded"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extensions"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<FileFilters>
  <scanAllFiles></scanAllFiles>
  <lastModifiedAfter></lastModifiedAfter>
  <extensionsIncluded></extensionsIncluded>
  <extensions></extensions>
</FileFilters>

/2.0/dlp/policy/classificationvalues

Configure a customized regex as a classification value

PUT /2.0/dlp/policy/classificationvalues

Configure a customized regex as a classification value

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="set">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="ClassificationValue">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element name="classification">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="providerName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="customizable"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<set>
  <ClassificationValue>
    <id></id>
    <classification>
      <id></id>
      <name></name>
      <providerName></providerName>
      <description></description>
      <customizable></customizable>
    </classification>
    <value></value>
  </ClassificationValue>
</set>

  • basic

/2.0/endpointsecurity

Work with Guest Introspection and Third-party Endpoint Protection (Anti-virus) Solutions

About Guest Introspection and Endpoint Protection Solutions

VMware's Guest Introspection Service enables vendors to deliver an introspection-based, endpoint protection (anti-virus) solution that uses the hypervisor to scan guest virtual machines from the outside, with only a thin agent on each guest virtual machine.

Version Compatibility

Note: The management APIs listed in this section are to be used only with partner endpoint protection solutions that were developed with EPSec Partner Program 3.0 or earlier (for vShield 5.5 or earlier). These partner solutions are also supported on NSX 6.0 and need the APIs listed below. These APIs should not be used with partner solutions developed specifically for NSX 6.0 or later, as these newer solutions automate the registration and deployment process by using the new features introduced in NSX. Using these with newer NSX 6.0 based solutions could result in loss of features.

Register a Solution

To register a third-party solution with Guest Introspection, clients can use four REST calls to do the following:

  1. Register the vendor.
  2. Register one or more solutions.
  3. Set the solution IP address and port (for all hosts).
  4. Activate registered solutions per host.

Note: Steps 1 through 3 need to be performed once per solution. Step 4 needs to be performed for each host.

Unregister a Solution

To unregister a solution, clients perform these steps in reverse:

  1. Deactivate solutions per host.
  2. Unset a solution’s IP address and port.
  3. Unregister solutions.
  4. Unregister the vendor.

Updating Registration Information

To update registration information for a vendor or solution, clients must:

  1. Unregister the vendor or solution.
  2. Reregister the vendor or solution.

/2.0/endpointsecurity/activation

Activate an Endpoint Protection Solution.

GET /2.0/endpointsecurity/activation

Retrieve activation information for all activated security VMs on the specified host.

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

hostId string required

Host ID associated with activated security VMs.

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<ActivatedSVMs>
  <ActivationInfo>
    <moid>vm-819</moid>
    <hostMoid>host-9</hostMoid>
    <vmName>VMWARE-Data Security-10.24.130.174</vmName>
    <hostName>10.24.130.174</hostName>
    <clusterName>Dev</clusterName>
    <dcName>dev</dcName>
    <vendorId>VMWARE</vendorId>
    <solutionId>6341068275337723904</solutionId>
  </ActivationInfo>
  ...
</ActivatedSVMs>

/2.0/endpointsecurity/activation/{vendorID}/{altitude}

Activate a registered endpoint protection solution.

URI Parameters

vendorID string required

VMware-assigned ID for the vendor.

altitude string required

VMware-assigned number to uniquely identify a solution. Describes the type of solution and the order in which the solution receives events relative to other solutions on the same host.

POST /2.0/endpointsecurity/activation/{vendorID}/{altitude}

Activate an endpoint protection solution that has been registered and located. Specify the following parameter in the request body.

Name Comments
svmMoid Managed object ID of the virtual machine of the activated endpoint protection solution.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ActivationInfo">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="moid"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<ActivationInfo>
  <moid>svmMoid</moid>
</ActivationInfo>

/2.0/endpointsecurity/activation/{vendorID}/{altitude}/{moid}

Get the activation status or deactivate an endpoint protection solution on a host.

URI Parameters

moid string required

Managed object reference of a VM.

GET /2.0/endpointsecurity/activation/{vendorID}/{altitude}/{moid}

Retrieve the endpoint protection solution activation status, either true (activated) or false (not activated).

Security

  • basic

DELETE /2.0/endpointsecurity/activation/{vendorID}/{altitude}/{moid}

Deactivate an endpoint protection solution on a host.

Security

  • basic

/2.0/endpointsecurity/activation/{vendorID}/{solutionID}

Activated security virtual machines

URI Parameters

vendorID string required

VMware-assigned ID for the vendor.

solutionID string required

solution ID for the endpoint protection solution.

GET /2.0/endpointsecurity/activation/{vendorID}/{solutionID}

Retrieve a list of activated security VMs for an endpoint protection solution.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<ActivatedSVMs>
  <ActivationInfo>
    <moid>vm-819</moid>
    <hostMoid>host-9</hostMoid>
    <vmName>VMWARE-Data Security-10.24.130.174</vmName>
    <hostName>10.24.130.174</hostName>
    <clusterName>Dev</clusterName>
    <dcName>dev</dcName>
    <vendorId>VMWARE</vendorId>
    <solutionId>6341068275337723904</solutionId>
  </ActivationInfo>
  ...
</ActivatedSVMs>

/2.0/endpointsecurity/registration/{vendorID}

Guest Introspection vendors and endpoint protection solutions

URI Parameters

vendorID string required

VMware-assigned ID for the vendor.

POST /2.0/endpointsecurity/registration/{vendorID}

Register an endpoint protection solution. Specify the following parameters in the request.

Name Comments
solutionAltitude VMware-assigned altitude for the solution. Altitude is a number that VMware assigns to uniquely identify the solution. The altitude describes the type of solution and the order in which the solution receives events relative to other solutions on the same host.
solutionTitle Vendor-specified title for the solution.
solutionDescription Vendor-specified description of the solution.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="SolutionInfo">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="altitude"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="title"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<SolutionInfo>
  <altitude>solutionAltitude</altitude>
  <title>solutionTitle</title>
  <description>solutionDescription</description>
</SolutionInfo>

/2.0/endpointsecurity/registration/{vendorID}/{altitude}/location

IP address and port for an endpoint protection solution.

To change the location of an endpoint protection solution:

  1. Deactivate all security virtual machines.
  2. Change the location.
  3. Reactivate all security virtual machines.

POST /2.0/endpointsecurity/registration/{vendorID}/{altitude}/location

Set the IP address and port on the vNIC host for an endpoint protection solution.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="LocationInfo">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ip"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<LocationInfo>
  <ip>solutionIpAddress</ip>
  <port>solutionIPPort</port>
</LocationInfo>

GET /2.0/endpointsecurity/registration/{vendorID}/{altitude}/location

Get the IP address and port on the vNIC host for an endpoint protection solution.

Security

  • basic

Security

  • basic

/2.0/nwfabric/configure

Working with Network Virtualization Components and VXLAN.

Cluster preparation can be broken down into the following:

  • Install VIB and non-VIB related action: Before any per-host config a VIB must be installed on the host. The feature can use this time to perform other bootstrapping tasks which do not depend on VIB-installation. e.g. VXLAN creates the vmknic-pg and sets up some opaque data.
  • Post-VIB install: Prepare each host for the feature. In the case of VXLAN, create vmknics.

POST /2.0/nwfabric/configure

Install network fabric or VXLAN.

You install the network infrastructure components in your virtual environment on a per‐cluster level for each vCenter server, which deploys the required software on all hosts in the cluster. This software is also referred to as an NSX vSwitch. When a new host is added to this cluster, the required software is automatically installed on the newly added host. After the network infrastructure is installed on a cluster, Logical Firewall is enabled on that cluster.

See examples for the following tasks:

  • Install Network Virtualization Components
  • Configure VXLAN
  • Configure VXLAN with LACPv2
  • Reset Communication
Name Comments
resourceId vCenter MOB ID of cluster. For example, domain-7. A host can be specified when resetting communication. For example, host-24.
featureId Feature to act upon. Omit for network virtualization components operations. Use com.vmware.vshield.vsm.vxlan for VXLAN operations, com.vmware.vshield.vsm.messagingInfra for message bus operations.
ipPoolId Used for VXLAN installation. If not specified, DHCP is used for VTEP address assignment.
teaming Used for VXLAN installation. Options are FAILOVER_ORDER, ETHER_CHANNEL, LACP_ACTIVE, LACP_PASSIVE, LOADBALANCE_LOADBASED, LOADBALANCE_SRCID, LOADBALANCE_SRCMAC, LACP_V2
uplinkPortName The uplinkPortName as specified in vCenter.

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

action string

Specify synchronize to reset communication between NSX Manager and a host or cluster.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="nwFabricFeatureConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="featureId"/>
        <xs:element name="resourceConfig">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="resourceId"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

* Install Network Virtualization Components

POST /api/2.0/nwfabric/configure

<nwFabricFeatureConfig>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId>CLUSTER MOID</resourceId>
  </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>

* Configure VXLAN

POST /api/2.0/nwfabric/configure

<nwFabricFeatureConfig>
  <featureId>com.vmware.vshield.vsm.vxlan</featureId>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId>CLUSTER MOID</resourceId>
    <configSpec class="clusterMappingSpec">
      <switch>
        <objectId>DVS MOID</objectId></switch>
        <vlanId>0</vlanId>
        <vmknicCount>1</vmknicCount>
        <ipPoolId>IPADDRESSPOOL ID</ipPoolId>
    </configSpec>
  </resourceConfig>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId>DVS MOID</resourceId>
    <configSpec class="vdsContext">
      <switch>
          <objectId>DVS MOID</objectId>
      </switch>
      <mtu>1600</mtu>
      <teaming>ETHER_CHANNEL</teaming>
    </configSpec>
  </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>

* Configure VXLAN with LACPv2

POST /api/2.0/nwfabric/configure

<nwFabricFeatureConfig>
  <featureId>com.vmware.vshield.nsxmgr.vxlan</featureId>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId>CLUSTER MOID</resourceId>
    <configSpec class="clusterMappingSpec">
      <switch>
        <objectId>DVS MOID</objectId>
      </switch>
      <vlanId>0</vlanId>
      <vmknicCount>1</vmknicCount>
    </configSpec>
  </resourceConfig>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId>DVS MOID</resourceId>
    <configSpec class="vdsContext">
      <switch>
        <objectId>DVS MOID</objectId>
      </switch>
      <mtu>1600</mtu>
      <teaming>LACP_V2</teaming>
      <uplinkPortName>LAG NAME</uplinkPortName>
    </configSpec>
  </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>

* Reset Communication

POST /api/2.0/nwfabric/configure?action=synchronize

<nwFabricFeatureConfig>
  <featureId>com.vmware.vshield.vsm.messagingInfra</featureId>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId>resourceId</resourceId>
  </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>

PUT /2.0/nwfabric/configure

Upgrade Network virtualization components.

This API call can be used to upgrade network virtualization components. After NSX Manager is upgraded, previously prepared clusters must have the 6.x network virtualization components installed.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="nwFabricFeatureConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="featureId"/>
        <xs:element name="resourceConfig">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="resourceId"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<nwFabricFeatureConfig>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId>CLUSTER MOID</resourceId>
  </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>

DELETE /2.0/nwfabric/configure

Remove VXLAN or network virtualization components.

Removing network virtualization components removes previously installed VIBs, tears down NSX Manager to ESXi messaging, and removes any other network fabric dependent features such as logical switches. If a feature such as logical switches is being used in your environment, this call fails.

Removing VXLAN does not remove the network virtualization components from the cluster.

Name Comments
resourceId vCenter MOB ID of cluster. For example, domain-7.
featureId Feature to act upon. Omit for network virtualization components operations. Use com.vmware.vshield.vsm.vxlan for VXLAN operations.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="nwFabricFeatureConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="featureId"/>
        <xs:element name="resourceConfig">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="resourceId"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

* Remove Network Virtualization Components

<nwFabricFeatureConfig>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId>CLUSTER MOID</resourceId>
  </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>

* Remove VXLAN

<nwFabricFeatureConfig>
  <featureId>com.vmware.vshield.vsm.vxlan</featureId>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId>CLUSTER MOID</resourceId>
   </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>

* Remove VXLAN with vDS context

<nwFabricFeatureConfig>
  <featureId>com.vmware.vshield.vsm.vxlan</featureId>
  <resourceConfig>
    <resourceId>CLUSTER MOID</resourceId>
    <configSpec class="map">
      <entry>
        <keyclass="java.lang.String">vxlan</key>
        <valueclass="java.lang.String">cascadeDeleteVdsContext</value>
      </entry>
    </configSpec>
  </resourceConfig>
</nwFabricFeatureConfig>

/2.0/nwfabric/features

GET /2.0/nwfabric/features

Retrieves all network fabric features available on the cluster. Multiple featureInfo sections may be returned.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<featureInfos>
  <featureInfo>
    <name>FEATURE NAME</name>
    <featureId>FEATURE ID</featureId>
    <version>FEATURE VERSION</version>
  </featureInfo>
<featureInfos>

/2.0/nwfabric/hosts/{hostID}

Working with locale ID configuration for hosts.

URI Parameters

hostID string required

GET /2.0/nwfabric/hosts/{hostID}

Security

  • basic

PUT /2.0/nwfabric/hosts/{hostID}

Update the locale ID for the specified host.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="nwFabricHostConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="localeId"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

  <localeId></localeId>
</nwFabricHostConfig>

DELETE /2.0/nwfabric/hosts/{hostID}

Security

  • basic

/2.0/nwfabric/status

Working with network fabric status.

GET /2.0/nwfabric/status

Retrieve the network fabric status of the specified resource.

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

resource string required

Set resource to the correct resourceId which is a valid vCenter MOID (e.g. domain-c34 for a cluster).

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<resourceStatuses>
  <resourceStatus>
    <resource>
      <objectId>resource-id</objectId>
      <objectTypeName>ClusterComputeResource</objectTypeName>
      <nsxmgrUuid>jfldj</nsxmgrUuid>
      <revision>2</revision>
      <type>
        <typeName>ClusterComputeResource</typeName>
      </type>
      <name>c-1</name>
      <scope>
        <id>datacenter-2</id>
        <objectTypeName>Datacenter</objectTypeName>
        <name>dc-1</name>
      </scope>
      <clientHandle></clientHandle>
      <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
    </resource>
    <nwFabricFeatureStatus>
      <featureId>com.vmware.vshield.nsxmgr.nwfabric.hostPrep</featureId>
      <featureVersion>5.5</featureVersion>
      <updateAvailable>false</updateAvailable>
      <status>RED</status>
      <message></message>
      <installed>true</installed>
    </nwFabricFeatureStatus>
    <nwFabricFeatureStatus>
      <featureId>com.vmware.vshield.nsxmgr.vxlan</featureId>
      <featureVersion>5.5</featureVersion>
      <updateAvailable>false</updateAvailable>
      <status>UNKNOWN</status>
      <installed>false</installed>
    </nwFabricFeatureStatus>
    <nwFabricFeatureStatus>
      <featureId>com.vmware.vshield.nsxmgr.messagingInfra</featureId>
      <featureVersion>5.5</featureVersion>
      <updateAvailable>false</updateAvailable>
      <status>UNKNOWN</status>
      <installed>false</installed>
    </nwFabricFeatureStatus>
    <nwFabricFeatureStatus>
      <featureId>com.vmware.vshield.firewall</featureId>
      <featureVersion>5.5</featureVersion>
      <updateAvailable>false</updateAvailable>
      <status>UNKNOWN</status>
      <installed>false</installed>
    </nwFabricFeatureStatus>
  </resourceStatus>
</resourceStatuses>

/2.0/services/application/scope/{scopeId}

Working with services on a scope

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

Can be "globalroot-0", "universalroot-0" or datacenterId in upgrade use cases.

GET /2.0/services/application/scope/{scopeId}

List services that have been created on the scope

Security

  • basic

POST /2.0/services/application/scope/{scopeId}

Create a new service on the specified scope

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="application">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:byte" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element name="element">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="applicationProtocol"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<application>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName/>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <revision></revision>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <element>
    <applicationProtocol>mandatory</applicationProtocol>
    <value>mandatory</value>
  </element>
</application>

/2.0/services/application/{applicationId}

Working with a specified service

URI Parameters

applicationId string required

Specified as returned by a servicesScope POST call

GET /2.0/services/application/{applicationId}

Retrieve details about the specified service

Security

  • basic

PUT /2.0/services/application/{applicationId}

Modify the name, description, applicationProtocol, or port value of a service

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="application">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element name="element">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="applicationProtocol"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<application>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <revision></revision>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <element>
    <applicationProtocol></applicationProtocol>
    <value></value>
  </element>
</application>

DELETE /2.0/services/application/{applicationId}

Delete the specified service

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

force boolean

Indicates if the delete should be forced or unforced. The default is unforced (false)

/2.0/services/applicationgroup

Operations on Application Groups

/2.0/services/applicationgroup/scope/{scopeId}

Working with service groups

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

The scopeId can be "globalroot-0", "universalroot-0" or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

POST /2.0/services/applicationgroup/scope/{scopeId}

Create a new service group on the specified scope

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="applicationGroup">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inheritanceAllowed"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<applicationGroup>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <revision></revision>
  <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
</applicationGroup>

GET /2.0/services/applicationgroup/scope/{scopeId}

Retrieve a list of service groups that have been created on the scope

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/applicationgroup/scope/{scopeId}/members

Get the members of a service group

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

GET /2.0/services/applicationgroup/scope/{scopeId}/members

Get a list of member elements that can be added to the service groups created on a particular scope.

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}

Working with an individual service group

URI Parameters

applicationgroupId string required

Application group ID

GET /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}

Retrieve details about a service group

Security

  • basic

PUT /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}

Modify the name, description, applicationProtocol, or port value of a service group

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="applicationGroup">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element name="scope">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inheritanceAllowed"/>
        <xs:element name="member">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element name="type">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element name="scope">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<applicationGroup>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <name></name>
  <description></description>
  <revision></revision>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <scope>
    <id></id>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <name></name>
  </scope>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttrubutes>
  <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
  <member>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <type>
      <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <revision></revision>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <scope>
      <id></id>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      <name></name>
    </scope>
  </member>
</applicationGroup>

DELETE /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

force boolean

Indicates if the delete should be forced or unforced. The default is unforced (false)

/2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}/members/{moref}

URI Parameters

moref string required

Management object reference to the member

  • basic

DELETE /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}/members/{moref}

Delete a member from the service group

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/ipam/pools

Working with IP pools.

/2.0/services/ipam/pools/scope/{scopeId}

Working with IP pools by scope.

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

For scopeID use globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

GET /2.0/services/ipam/pools/scope/{scopeId}

Retrieves all IP pools on the specified scope where the scopeID is the reference to the desired scope. An example of the scopeID is globalroot-0.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<ipamAddressPool>
  <objectId>ipaddresspool-1</objectId>
  <objectTypeName>IpAddressPool</objectTypeName>
  <vsmUuid>4237BA90-C373-A71A-9827-1673BFA29498</vsmUuid>
  <revision>1</revision>
  <type>
    <typeName>IpAddressPool</typeName>
  </type>
  <name>rest-ip-pool-1</name>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  <prefixLength>23</prefixLength>
  <gateway>192.168.1.1</gateway>
  <dnsSuffix>example.com</dnsSuffix>
  <dnsServer1>10.11.0.1</dnsServer1>
  <dnsServer2>10.11.0.2</dnsServer2>
  <ipRanges>
    <ipRangeDto>
      <id>iprange-1</id>
      <startAddress>192.168.1.2</startAddress>
      <endAddress>192.168.1.3</endAddress>
    </ipRangeDto>
  </ipRanges>
  <totalAddressCount>2</totalAddressCount>
  <usedAddressCount>0</usedAddressCount>
  <usedPercentage>0</usedPercentage>
</ipamAddressPool>

POST /2.0/services/ipam/pools/scope/{scopeId}

You can create a pool of IP addresses. For scopeId use globalroot-0 or the datacenterId in upgrade use cases.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipamAddressPool">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="prefixLength"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="gateway"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsSuffix"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsServer1"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsServer2"/>
        <xs:element name="ipRanges">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="ipRangeDto">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="startAddress"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="endAddress"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<ipamAddressPool>
  <name></name>
  <prefixLength></prefixLength>
  <gateway></gateway>
  <dnsSuffix></dnsSuffix>
  <dnsServer1></dnsServer1>
  <dnsServer2></dnsServer2>
  <ipRanges>
    <ipRangeDto>
      <startAddress></startAddress>
      <endAddress></endAddress>
    </ipRangeDto>
  </ipRanges>
</ipamAddressPool>

/2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}

Working with a specified IP pool.

URI Parameters

poolId string required

Specifiy the pool ID as poolId in the URI.

GET /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}

Retrieve details about a specific IP pool.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<ipamAddressPool>
  <objectId>ipaddresspool-1</objectId>
  <objectTypeName>IpAddressPool</objectTypeName>
  <vsmUuid>4237BA90-C373-A71A-9827-1673BFA29498</vsmUuid>
  <revision>1</revision>
  <type>
    <typeName>IpAddressPool</typeName>
  </type>
  <name>rest-ip-pool-1</name>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  <prefixLength>23</prefixLength>
  <gateway>192.168.1.1</gateway>
  <dnsSuffix>example.com</dnsSuffix>
  <dnsServer1>10.11.0.1</dnsServer1>
  <dnsServer2>10.11.0.2</dnsServer2>
  <ipRanges>
    <ipRangeDto>
      <id>iprange-1</id>
      <startAddress>192.168.1.2</startAddress>
      <endAddress>192.168.1.3</endAddress>
    </ipRangeDto>
  </ipRanges>
  <totalAddressCount>2</totalAddressCount>
  <usedAddressCount>0</usedAddressCount>
  <usedPercentage>0</usedPercentage>
</ipamAddressPool>

PUT /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}

To modify an IP pool, query the IP pool first. Then modify the output and send it back as the request body.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipamAddressPool">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="prefixLength"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="gateway"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsSuffix"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsServer1"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsServer2"/>
        <xs:element name="ipRanges">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="ipRangeDto">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="startAddress"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="endAddress"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<ipamAddressPool>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
  <revision></revision>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <name></name>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  <prefixLength></prefixLength>
  <gateway></gateway>
  <dnsSuffix></dnsSuffix>
  <dnsServer1></dnsServer1>
  <dnsServer2></dnsServer2>
  <ipRanges>
    <ipRangeDto>
      <id></id>
      <startAddress></startAddress>
      <endAddress></endAddress>
    </ipRangeDto>
  </ipRanges>
</ipamAddressPool>

DELETE /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}

Delete an IP pool

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}/ipaddresses

Work with IP's and their allocation status in IP Pools

GET /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}/ipaddresses

Retrieves all allocated IP addresses from the specified pool.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<allocatedIpAddresses>
  <allocatedIpAddress>
    <id>allocatedipaddress-4</id>
    <ipAddress>192.168.1.2</ipAddress>
    <gateway>192.168.1.1</gateway>
    <prefixLength>23</prefixLength>
    <dnsServer1>10.112.0.1</dnsServer1>
    <dnsServer2>10.112.0.2</dnsServer2>
    <dnsSuffix>eng.vmware.com</dnsSuffix>
    <allocationNote>sample note</allocationNote>
  </allocatedIpAddress>
</allocatedIpAddresses>

POST /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}/ipaddresses

Allocate an IP Address from the pool. Use 'ALLOCATE' in the 'allocationMode' field in the body to allocate the next available ip. To allocate a specific one use 'RESERVE' and pass the IP to reserve in the 'ipAddress' fields in the body.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipAddressRequest">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="allocationMode"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipAddress"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<ipAddressRequest>
  <allocationMode>ALLOCATE</allocationMode>
  <ipAddress>192.168.1.2</ipAddress>
</ipAddressRequest>

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<allocatedIpAddress>
  <id>allocatedipaddress-1</id>
  <ipAddress>192.168.1.2</ipAddress>
  <gateway>192.168.1.1</gateway>
  <prefixLength>23</prefixLength>
  <dnsServer1>10.112.0.1</dnsServer1>
  <dnsServer2>10.112.0.2</dnsServer2>
  <dnsSuffix>eng.vmware.com</dnsSuffix>
  <allocationNote/>sample note</allocationNote>
</allocatedIpAddress>

/2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}/ipaddresses/{ipAddress}

Release an IP Address allocation in the Pool

URI Parameters

ipAddress string required

The IP address to release, e.g. '192.168.10.10'

DELETE /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}/ipaddresses/{ipAddress}

Release an IP Address allocation in the Pool

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/ipset

Operations on IP Sets

/2.0/services/ipset/scope/{scopeMoref}

URI Parameters

scopeMoref string required

For scopeMoref use "globalroot-0" for non-universal IP sets and use "universalroot-0" for universal IP sets.

GET /2.0/services/ipset/scope/{scopeMoref}

Retrieve all configured IPSets

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/ipset/{ipsetId}

URI Parameters

ipsetId string required

The IPset to be queried or changed

GET /2.0/services/ipset/{ipsetId}

Retrieve an individual IPset

Security

  • basic

PUT /2.0/services/ipset/{ipsetId}

Modify an existing IPset

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipset">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inheritanceAllowed"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<ipset>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <value></value>
</ipset>

  • basic

    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inheritanceAllowed"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>

/2.0/services/licensing/capacityusage

The licensing capacity usage API command reports usage of CPUs, VMs and concurrent users for the distributed firewall and VXLAN.

GET /2.0/services/licensing/capacityusage

Read capacity usage information on the useage of CPUs, VMs and concurrent users for the distributed firewall and VXLAN.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<featureCapacityUsageList>
  <featureCapacityUsageInfo>
    <capacityUsageInfo>
      <capacityType></capacityType>
      <usageCount></usageCount>
    </capacityUsageInfo>
    <feature></feature>
  </featureCapacityUsageInfo>
</featureCapacityUsageList>

/2.0/services/macset

Working with MAC sets.

/2.0/services/macset/scope/{scopeId}

Working with MAC Sets.

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

Can be "globalroot-0", "universalroot-0" or datacenterId in upgrade use cases. Universal MAC sets are read-only from secondary managers.

POST /2.0/services/macset/scope/{scopeId}

Create a MACset on a specified scope

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="macset">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<macset>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <revision></revision>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <value></value>
</macset>

GET /2.0/services/macset/scope/{scopeId}

List MACsets created on a specified scope

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<list>
  <macset>
    <objectId>macset-1</objectId>
    <objectTypeName>MACSet</objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid>4226CACF-0558-AFF3-5D92-279B201C40E2</vsmUuid>
    <nodeId>72eee9ab-bb75-49ba-a782-d7dffedd180a</nodeId>
    <revision>4</revision>
    <type>
      <typeName>MACSet</typeName>
    </type>
    <name>system-generated-broadcast-macset</name>
    <scope>
      <id>globalroot-0</id>
      <objectTypeName>GlobalRoot</objectTypeName>
      <name>Global</name>
    </scope>
    <clientHandle></clientHandle>
    <extendedAttributes>
      <extendedAttribute>
        <name>isReadOnly</name>
        <value>true</value>
      </extendedAttribute>
      <extendedAttribute>
        <name>isHidden</name>
        <value>true</value>
      </extendedAttribute>
      <extendedAttribute>
        <name>facadeHidden</name>
        <value>true</value>
      </extendedAttribute>
    </extendedAttributes>
    <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
    <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
    <inheritanceAllowed>false</inheritanceAllowed>
    <value>FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF</value>
  </macset>
</list>

/2.0/services/macset/{macsetId}

Operations on an individual MAC set

macsetId string required

Specified MACset ID (Can be retrieved by listing the MACset on a scope)

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<macset>
  <objectId>macset-1</objectId>
  <objectTypeName>MACSet</objectTypeName>
  <vsmUuid>4226CACF-0558-AFF3-5D92-279B201C40E2</vsmUuid>
  <nodeId>72eee9ab-bb75-49ba-a782-d7dffedd180a</nodeId>
  <revision>4</revision>
  <type>
  <typeName>MACSet</typeName>
  </type>
  <name>system-generated-broadcast-macset</name>
  <scope>
    <id>globalroot-0</id>
    <objectTypeName>GlobalRoot</objectTypeName>
    <name>Global</name>
  </scope>
  <clientHandle></clientHandle>
  <extendedAttributes>
    <extendedAttribute>
      <name>isReadOnly</name>
      <value>true</value>
    </extendedAttribute>
    <extendedAttribute>
      <name>isHidden</name>
      <value>true</value>
    </extendedAttribute>
    <extendedAttribute>
      <name>facadeHidden</name>
      <value>true</value>
    </extendedAttribute>
  </extendedAttributes>
  <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
  <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
  <inheritanceAllowed>false</inheritanceAllowed>
  <value>FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF</value>
</macset>

PUT /2.0/services/macset/{macsetId}

Modify an existing MAC set.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="macset">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<macset>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <description></description>
  <name></name>
  <revision></revision>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <value></value>
</macset>

DELETE /2.0/services/macset/{macsetId}

Delete a MAC set

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

force boolean

Indicates forced or unforced delete. With forced delete, the object is deleted even if used in other places such as firewall rules, causing invalid referrals. For unforced delete, the object is deleted only if it is no used by other configurations; otherwise the delete fails.

/2.0/services/policy

Operations on policy objects

/2.0/services/policy/policy/securitygroup/{ID}/securitypolicies

Retrieve security policies mapped to a security group

URI Parameters

ID string required

Specified security group ID

GET /2.0/services/policy/policy/securitygroup/{ID}/securitypolicies

Retrieve security policies mapped to a security group

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/policy/policy/serviceprovider/firewall

Synchronizing Service Composer rules with distributed firewall

GET /2.0/services/policy/policy/serviceprovider/firewall

Query the time since when Service Composer firewall is out of sync with dfw, or synchronize Service Composer firewall with dfw

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/policy/securityaction/category/virtualmachines

Virtual machines for a security action

GET /2.0/services/policy/securityaction/category/virtualmachines

Fetch all vm objects on which security action of a given category and attribute has been applied

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

attributeKey string

Attribute name

attributeValue string

Attribute value

/2.0/services/policy/securitygroup/{ID}/securityactions

Security actions on a security group

URI Parameters

ID string required

Specified security group

GET /2.0/services/policy/securitygroup/{ID}/securityactions

Query all security actions applicable on a security group

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/policy/securitypolicy

Working with security policies (Endpoint, firewall, network introspection services applied to security group)

POST /2.0/services/policy/securitypolicy

Create a security policy

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securityPolicy">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="precedence"/>
        <xs:element name="parent">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="securityGroupBinding">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="actionsByCategory">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="category"/>
              <xs:element name="action">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="category"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="actionType"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isActionEnforced"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isActive"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isEnabled"/>
                    <xs:element name="secondarySecurityGroup">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="applications">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element name="application">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                          <xs:element name="applicationGroup">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="logged"/>
                    <xs:element name="scope">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                  <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="class"/>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="direction"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="outsideSecondaryContainer"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<securityPolicy>
  <name></name>
  <description></description>
  <precedence></precedence>
  <parent>
    <objectId></objectId>
  </parent>
  <securityGroupBinding>
    <objectId></objectId>
  </securityGroupBinding>
  <actionsByCategory>
    <category></category>
    <action class="">
      <name></name>
      <description></description>
      <category></category>
      <actionType></actionType>
      <isActionEnforced></isActionEnforced>
      <isActive></isActive>
      <isEnabled></isEnabled>
      <secondarySecurityGroup>
        <objectId></objectId>
      </secondarySecurityGroup>
      <applications>
        <application>
          <objectId></objectId>
        </application>
        <applicationGroup>
          <objectId></objectId>
        </applicationGroup>
      </applications>
      <logged></logged>
      <scope>
        <id></id>
        <name></name>
        <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      </scope>
    </action>
    <direction></direction>
    <outsideSecondaryContainer></outsideSecondaryContainer>
    </actionsByCategory>
</securityPolicy>

/2.0/services/policy/securitypolicy/hierarchy

POST /2.0/services/policy/securitypolicy/hierarchy

Import a security policy configuration

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

suffix string

(optional) Added after names

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securityPolicyHierarchy">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="securityPolicy"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="securityGroup"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<securityPolicyHierarchy>
  <name></name>
  <description></description>
  <securityPolicy></securityPolicy>
  <securityGroup></securityGroup>
</securityPolicyHierarchy>

GET /2.0/services/policy/securitypolicy/hierarchy

Export a Service Composer configuration and save to your desktop for use as a backup

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

policyIds string

Comma separated security policy id's

prefix string

(optional) Some prefix to add before the names of the objects in the exported XML

/2.0/services/policy/securitypolicy/{ID}

Specific security policy

URI Parameters

ID string required

ID of desired security policy (or 'all' to include all security policies for the securityPolicyID read method)

GET /2.0/services/policy/securitypolicy/{ID}
