Security

  • basic

PUT /2.0/services/policy/securitypolicy/{ID}

Edit a security policy

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securityPolicy">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="securityPolicy">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="precedence"/>
              <xs:element name="parent">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="securityGroupBinding">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="actionsByCategory">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="category"/>
                    <xs:element name="action">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="category"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="actionType"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isActionEnforced"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isActive"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isEnabled"/>
                          <xs:element name="secondarySecurityGroup">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                          <xs:element name="applications">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element name="application">
                                  <xs:complexType>
                                    <xs:sequence>
                                      <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                                    </xs:sequence>
                                  </xs:complexType>
                                </xs:element>
                                <xs:element name="applicationGroup">
                                  <xs:complexType>
                                    <xs:sequence>
                                      <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
                                    </xs:sequence>
                                  </xs:complexType>
                                </xs:element>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="logged"/>
                          <xs:element name="scope">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                        </xs:sequence>
                        <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="class"/>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="direction"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="outsideSecondaryContainer"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<securityPolicy>
  <securityPolicy>
    <name></name>
    <description></description>
    <precedence></precedence>
    <parent>
      <objectId></objectId>
    </parent>
    <securityGroupBinding>
      <objectId></objectId>
    </securityGroupBinding>
    <actionsByCategory>
      <category></category>
      <action class="">
        <name></name>
        <description></description>
        <category></category>
        <actionType></actionType>
        <isActionEnforced></isActionEnforced>
        <isActive></isActive>
        <isEnabled></isEnabled>
        <secondarySecurityGroup>
          <objectId></objectId>
        </secondarySecurityGroup>
        <applications>
          <application>
            <objectId></objectId>
          </application>
          <applicationGroup>
            <objectId></objectId>
          </applicationGroup>
        </applications>
        <logged></logged>
        <scope>
          <id></id>
          <name></name>
          <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
        </scope>
      </action>
      <direction></direction>
      <outsideSecondaryContainer></outsideSecondaryContainer>
    </actionsByCategory>
  </securityPolicy>
</securityPolicy>

DELETE /2.0/services/policy/securitypolicy/{ID}

Delete a security policy

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

force boolean

If set to true, security policy is deleted even if it is being used somewhere

/2.0/services/policy/securitypolicy/{ID}/securityactions

Security actions for a security policy

GET /2.0/services/policy/securitypolicy/{ID}/securityactions

Retrieve security actions for a security policy

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/policy/virtualmachine/{ID}/securityactions

Fetch the security actions applicable on a virtual machine

URI Parameters

ID string required

VM ID

GET /2.0/services/policy/virtualmachine/{ID}/securityactions

Fetch the security actions applicable on a virtual machine

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/securitygroup

Operations on securitygroups

/2.0/services/securitygroup/bulk/{scopeId}

Create a new security group on a global scope or universal scope. Use either "globalroot-0" or "universalroot-0". Universal security groups are read-only when querying a secondary NSX manager.

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

For the scopeId use globalroot-0 for non-universal security groups and universalroot-0 for universal security groups.

POST /2.0/services/securitygroup/bulk/{scopeId}

Create a new security group on a global scope

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securitygroup">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element name="scope">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
        <xs:element name="member">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
              <xs:element name="type">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element name="scope">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="excludeMember">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
              <xs:element name="type">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element name="scope">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="dynamicMemberDefinition">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="dynamicSet">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="operator"/>
                    <xs:element name="dynamicCriteria">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="operator"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="key"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="criteria"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<securitygroup>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
  <revision></revision>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <name></name>
  <scope>
    <id></id>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <name></name>
    <revision></revision>
  </scope>
  <clientHandle></clientHandle>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  <member>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <revision></revision>
    <type>
      <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <scope>
      <id></id>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      <name></name>
    </scope>
    <clientHandle></clientHandle>
    <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  </member>
  <excludeMember>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <revision></revision>
    <type>
      <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <scope>
      <id></id>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      <name></name>
    </scope>
    <clientHandle></clientHandle>
    <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  </excludeMember>
  <dynamicMemberDefinition>
    <dynamicSet>
      <operator></operator>
      <dynamicCriteria>
        <operator></operator>
        <key></key>
        <criteria></criteria>
        <value></value>
      </dynamicCriteria>
    </dynamicSet>
  </dynamicMemberDefinition>
</securitygroup>

  <xs:element name="securitygroup">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element name="scope">
          <xs:complexType>

              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>

                  </xs:sequence>

              </xs:element>

        </xs:element>

            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vsmUuid"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
              <xs:element name="type">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element name="scope">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="dynamicMemberDefinition">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="dynamicSet">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="operator"/>

                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="operator"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="key"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="criteria"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

      <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <scope>
      <id></id>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
      <name></name>
    </scope>

    <extendedAttributes/>
  </member>

    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>

    </type>

      <id></id>
      <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>

      <operator></operator>

        <criteria></criteria>
        <value></value>
      </dynamicCriteria>
    </dynamicSet>
  </dynamicMemberDefinition>
</securitygroup>

/2.0/services/securitygroup/internal/scope/{scopeId}

Information on internal security groups

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

Specified transport zone (scope)

GET /2.0/services/securitygroup/internal/scope/{scopeId}

Retrieve all internal security groups on the NSX Manager. These are used internally by the system and should not be created or modified by end users.

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/securitygroup/lookup/virtualmachine/{virtualMachineId}

Retrieve list of security groups that the specified virtual machine belongs to.

URI Parameters

virtualMachineId string required

Specified virtual machine

GET /2.0/services/securitygroup/lookup/virtualmachine/{virtualMachineId}

Retrieve list of security groups that the specified virtual machine belongs to.

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/securitygroup/scope/{scopeId}

Operations to list information about security groups on a given scope

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

scopeId can be "globalroot-0", "universalroot-0" or datacenterID / portgroupID in upgrade use cases

GET /2.0/services/securitygroup/scope/{scopeId}

List all the security groups created on a specific scope

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/securitygroup/{objectId}

Operations for an individual security group

Specified security group

  • basic

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securitygroup">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element name="scope">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="id"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="revision"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientHandle"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isUniversal"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="inheritanceAllowed"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<securitygroup>
  <objectId></objectId>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <revision></revision>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <name></name>
  <scope>
    <id></id>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <name></name>
  </scope>
  <clientHandle></clientHandle>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
  <isUniversal></isUniversal>
  <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
</securitygroup>

/2.0/services/securitytags/tag

Working with security tags

POST /2.0/services/securitytags/tag

Create a new security tag

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="securityTag">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectTypeName"/>
        <xs:element name="type">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="typeName"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="extendedAttributes"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<securityTag>
  <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
  <type>
    <typeName></typeName>
  </type>
  <name></name>
  <description></description>
  <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
</securityTag>

/2.0/services/ssoconfig

Operations on NSX Manager SSO registration

GET /2.0/services/ssoconfig

Query SSO Details

Security

  • basic

POST /2.0/services/ssoconfig

Register NSX Manager to SSO Services

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ssoConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ssoLookupServiceUrl"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ssoAdminUsername"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ssoAdminUserpassword"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="certificateThumbprint"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<ssoConfig>
  <ssoLookupServiceUrl></ssoLookupServiceUrl>
  <ssoAdminUsername></ssoAdminUsername>
  <ssoAdminUserpassword></ssoAdminUserpassword>
  <certificateThumbprint></certificateThumbprint>
</ssoConfig>

DELETE /2.0/services/ssoconfig

Deletes the NSX Manager SSO Configuration

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/ssoconfig/status

Query the SSO configuration status of NSX Manager

GET /2.0/services/ssoconfig/status

Query the SSO configuration status of NSX Manager

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/taskservice/job

Working with filtering criteria and paging information for jobs on the task framework

GET /2.0/services/taskservice/job

Query job instances by criterion

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

startIndex integer

The starting point for returning results.

pageSize integer

The number of results to return.

sortBy string

Always sorted by "startTime"

sortOrderAscending boolean

Sort in ascending order of start time (true/false)

/2.0/services/taskservice/job/{jobId}

Job instances on the task framework

URI Parameters

jobId string required

Specified job Id

GET /2.0/services/taskservice/job/{jobId}

Retrieve all job instances for the specified job ID

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/truststore

Operation on truststore (certificates)

/2.0/services/truststore/certificate

Certificates and certificate chains

POST /2.0/services/truststore/certificate

Create certificate for CSR

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="trustObject">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="pemEncoding"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<trustObject>
  <pemEncoding></pemEncoding>
</trustObject>

/2.0/services/truststore/certificate/scope/{scopeId}

Certificates for a scope

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

Scope ID

GET /2.0/services/truststore/certificate/scope/{scopeId}

Query all certificates for a scope

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/truststore/certificate/{certificateId}

Certificate specified by ID

URI Parameters

certificateId string required

Certificate ID

GET /2.0/services/truststore/certificate/{certificateId}

Retrieve the certificate object specified by ID. If the ID specifies a chain, multiple certificate objects are retrieved.

Security

  • basic

DELETE /2.0/services/truststore/certificate/{certificateId}

Delete the specified certificate

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/truststore/certificate/{scopeId}

Working with vShield Edge self-signed certificates

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

Scope ID

POST /2.0/services/truststore/certificate/{scopeId}

Create a single certificate

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="trustObject">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="pemEncoding"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="privateKey"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passphrase"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<trustObject>
  <pemEncoding></pemEncoding>
  <privateKey></privateKey>
  <passphrase></passphrase>
</trustObject>

GET /2.0/services/truststore/crl/scope/{scopeId}

/2.0/services/truststore/csr/{csrId}

Self signed certificate for CSR

URI Parameters

csrId string required

CSR ID

PUT /2.0/services/truststore/csr/{csrId}

Create a self signed certificate for CSR

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

noOfDays string required

GET /2.0/services/truststore/csr/{csrId}

Retrieve specific CSR

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/truststore/csr/{scopeId}

Create Certificate Signing Requests (CSRs)

URI Parameters

scopeId string required

Specified scope ID

POST /2.0/services/truststore/csr/{scopeId}

Create a CSR

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="csr">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="subject">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="attribute">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="key"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="algorithm"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="keySize"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<csr>
  <subject>
    <attribute>
      <key></key>
      <value></value>
    </attribute>
  </subject>
  <algorithm></algorithm>
  <keySize></keySize>
</csr>

/2.0/services/usermgmt

User Management Operations

/2.0/services/usermgmt/enablestate/{value}

Change the state of a user account (enabled/disabled)

URI Parameters

value integer required

value can be 0 to disable, or 1 to enable

PUT /2.0/services/usermgmt/enablestate/{value}

Enable or disable a user account

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

Manage roles for users

URI Parameters

userId string required

user to retrieve role information from

GET /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

Retrieve a user's role (possible roles are super_user, vshield_admin, enterprise_admin, security_admin, and audit)

Security

  • basic

POST /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

Add role and resources for a user

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

isGroup boolean required

Set to "true" to apply to a group; set to "false" to apply to an individual user

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="user">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="firstName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="lastName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="disableUserAccount"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passwordNeverExpires"/>
        <xs:element name="allowChangePassword">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="changePasswordOnNextLogin"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<accessControlEntry>
  <role></role>
  <resource>
    <resourceId></resourceId>
  </resource>
</accessControlEntry>

PUT /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

Change a user's role

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="user">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="firstName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="lastName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="disableUserAccount"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passwordNeverExpires"/>
        <xs:element name="allowChangePassword">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="changePasswordOnNextLogin"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<accessControlEntry>
  <role></role>
  <resource>
    <resourceId></resourceId>
  </resource>
</accessControlEntry>

DELETE /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

Delete the role assignment for specified vCenter user. Once this role is deleted, the user is removed from NSX Manager. You cannot delete the role for a local user.

Security

  • basic

GET /2.0/services/usermgmt/roles

Security

  • basic

Retrieve a list of objects that can be used to define a user's access scope

Security

  • basic

URI Parameters

userId string required

user ID

  • basic

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/usermgmt/users/vsm

GET /2.0/services/usermgmt/users/vsm

Get information about users who have been assigned a NSX Manager role (local users as well as vCenter users with NSX Manager role)

Security

  • basic

/2.0/services/vcconfig

Configuring NSX Manager with vCenter Server

GET /2.0/services/vcconfig

Get vCenter Server configuration details on NSX Manager

Security

  • basic

PUT /2.0/services/vcconfig

Synchronize NSX Manager with vCenter server

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="vcInfo">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipAddress"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="certificateThumbprint"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="assignRoleToUser"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="pluginDownloadServer"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="pluginDownloadPort"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<vcInfo>
  <ipAddress></ipAddress>
  <userName></userName>
  <password></password>
  <certificateThumbprint></certificateThumbprint>
  <assignRoleToUser></assignRoleToUser>
  <pluginDownloadServer></pluginDownloadServer>
  <pluginDownloadPort></pluginDownloadPort>
</vcInfo>

/2.0/si

Operations for solution Integrations

/2.0/si/agent/{agentID}

Agent details (host components and appliances)

URI Parameters

agentID string required

Specified agent

GET /2.0/si/agent/{agentID}

Retrieve agent details

Security

  • basic

/2.0/si/deploy

Security fabric

POST /2.0/si/deploy

Deploy security fabric

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

startTime string

Time to start deployment task. If not specified, deploy immediately

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="clusterDeploymentConfigs">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="clusterDeploymentConfig">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clusterId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="datastore"/>
              <xs:element name="services">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="serviceDeploymentConfig">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="serviceId"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dvPortGroup"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipPool"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<clusterDeploymentConfigs>
  <clusterDeploymentConfig>
    <clusterId></clusterId>
    <datastore></datastore>
    <services>
      <serviceDeploymentConfig>
        <serviceId></serviceId>
        <dvPortGroup></dvPortGroup>
        <ipPool></ipPool>
      </serviceDeploymentConfig>
    </services>
  </clusterDeploymentConfig>
</clusterDeploymentConfigs>

PUT /2.0/si/deploy

Upgrade service to recent version

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

startTime string

optional; specify time to start upgrade

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="clusterDeploymentConfigs">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="clusterDeploymentConfig">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clusterId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="datastore"/>
              <xs:element name="services">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="serviceDeploymentConfig">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="serviceId"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="serviceInstanceId"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dvPortGroup"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipPool"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<clusterDeploymentConfigs>
  <clusterDeploymentConfig>
    <clusterId></clusterId>
    <datastore></datastore>
    <services>
      <serviceDeploymentConfig>
        <serviceId></serviceId>
        <serviceInstanceId></serviceInstanceId>
        <dvPortGroup></dvPortGroup>
        <ipPool></ipPool>
      </serviceDeploymentConfig>
    </services>
  </clusterDeploymentConfig>
</clusterDeploymentConfigs>

/2.0/si/deploy/cluster/{clusterID}

Working with installed services on a cluster

URI Parameters

clusterID string required

Cluster ID

GET /2.0/si/deploy/cluster/{clusterID}

Retrieve all services deployed along with their status

Security

  • basic

DELETE /2.0/si/deploy/cluster/{clusterID}

Uninstall a service. Fails if you try to remove a service that another service depends on

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

services string

Comma-separated list of service id's to specify which services to uninstall

startTime string

Time for uninstall to be scheduled. If not specified, do immediately

/2.0/si/deploy/cluster/{clusterID}/service/{serviceID}

Information about a service

URI Parameters

serviceID string required

Service ID on cluster

GET /2.0/si/deploy/cluster/{clusterID}/service/{serviceID}

Retrieve detailed information about the service

Security

  • basic

/2.0/si/deploy/service/{serviceID}

Working with a specified service

URI Parameters

serviceID string required

Specified service

GET /2.0/si/deploy/service/{serviceID}

Retrieve all clusters on which the service is installed

Security

  • basic

DELETE /2.0/si/deploy/service/{serviceID}

Uninstall specified service from specified clusters

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

clusters string

Comma-separated list of cluster id's that service needs to be uninstalled from

startTime string

Time for uninstall to be scheduled. If not specified, uninstall immediately

/2.0/si/deploy/service/{serviceID}/dependsOn

Identify service on which the specified service depends on

GET /2.0/si/deploy/service/{serviceID}/dependsOn

  • basic

  • basic

/2.0/si/fabric/sync/conflicts

Working with conflicting agencies

GET /2.0/si/fabric/sync/conflicts

Retrieve conflicting Deployment Units and EAM Agencies, if any, and the allowed operations on them

Security

  • basic

PUT /2.0/si/fabric/sync/conflicts

Create deployment units for conflicting EAM Agencies, delete conflicting EAM agencies, or delete deployment units for conflicting EAM agencies

Security

  • basic

<conflictResolverInfo>
  <agencyAction></agencyAction>
</conflictResolverInfo>

GET /2.0/si/host/{hostID}/agents

GET /2.0/systemevent

Get NSX Manager system events

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

startIndex string

The starting point for returning results.

pageSize string

The number of results to return. Range is 1-1024.

/2.0/universalsync

Configuring Universal Sync for the NSX manager

/2.0/universalsync/configuration

/2.0/universalsync/configuration/nsxmanagers

Universal sync configuration of NSX managers

POST /2.0/universalsync/configuration/nsxmanagers

Create a secondary NSX manager

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="nsxManagerInfo">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="nsxManagerIp"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="nsxManagerUsername"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="nsxManagerPassword"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="certificateThumbprint"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isPrimary"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<nsxManagerInfo>
  <nsxManagerIp></nsxManagerIp>
  <nsxManagerUsername></nsxManagerUsername>
  <nsxManagerPassword></nsxManagerPassword>
  <certificateThumbprint></certificateThumbprint>
  <isPrimary></isPrimary>
</nsxManagerInfo>

DELETE /2.0/universalsync/configuration/nsxmanagers

Delete secondary NSX manager configuration

Security

  • basic

/2.0/universalsync/configuration/nsxmanagers/thumbprint

Universal sync configuration NSX manager thumbprint

PUT /2.0/universalsync/configuration/nsxmanagers/thumbprint

Update the NSX manager thumprint in the universal sync configuration

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="nsxManagerInfo">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="uuid"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="nsxManagerIp"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="certificateThumbprint"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isPrimary"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<nsxManagerInfo>
  <uuid></uuid>
  <nsxManagerIp></nsxManagerIp>
  <certificateThumbprint></certificateThumbprint>
  <isPrimary></isPrimary>
</nsxManagerInfo>

/2.0/universalsync/configuration/nsxmanagers/{nsxManagerID}

Universal sync configuration of a specific NSX manager

URI Parameters

nsxManagerID string required

GET /2.0/universalsync/configuration/nsxmanagers/{nsxManagerID}

Query universal sync configuration information on a specific NSX manager by ID

Security

  • basic

DELETE /2.0/universalsync/configuration/nsxmanagers/{nsxManagerID}

Delete a secondary NSX manager by ID.

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

forceRemoval boolean

Force removal of a secondary NSX manager. Options are true and false.

/2.0/universalsync/configuration/role

Universal Sync Configuration

POST /2.0/universalsync/configuration/role

  • basic

Query Parameters

action string

Set the role of the NSX manager. Possible values are set-as-standalone, set-as-primary, set-as-secondary

GET /2.0/universalsync/configuration/role

Get the Universal Sync Configuration role

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

objectType string

Specifiy the object type. For example "VdnScope"

objectId string

Specify the bojectID. For example "globalvdnscope"

  • basic

/2.0/universalsync/sync

POST /2.0/universalsync/sync

Sync all objects on the NSX manager

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

action string

Use "invoke" to sync all objects on the NSX manager

/2.0/vdn/config

Working with Segement ID Pools and Multicast Ranges

/2.0/vdn/config/multicasts

Working with multicast address ranges.

If any of your transport zones will use multicast or hybrid replication mode, you must add a multicast address range (also called a multicast address pool). Specifying a multicast address range helps in spreading traffic across your network to avoid overloading a single multicast address.

POST /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts

Add a multicast address range for logical switches.

The address range includes the beginning and ending addresses.

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

isUniversal boolean

Set to true when creating a universal multicast address range.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="multicastRange">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="desc"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="begin"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="end"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<multicastRange>
  <name>Range 2</name>
  <begin>237.0.0.0</begin>
  <end>237.255.255.255</end>
</multicastRange>

GET /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts

Retrieve information about all configured multicast address ranges.

Universal multicast address ranges have the property isUniversal set to true.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<multicastRanges>
  <multicastRange>
    <id>5</id>
    <name>239.0.0.0-239.255.255.255</name>
    <begin>239.0.0.0</begin>
    <end>239.255.255.255</end>
    <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
    <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
  </multicastRange>
  <multicastRange>
    <id>10</id>
    <name>Range 2</name>
    <begin>237.0.0.0</begin>
    <end>237.255.255.255</end>
    <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
    <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
  </multicastRange>
</multicastRanges>

/2.0/vdn/config/multicasts/{multicastAddresssRangeId}

Working With a Specific Multicast Address Range

URI Parameters

multicastAddresssRangeId string required

A valid multicast address range ID

GET /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts/{multicastAddresssRangeId}

Retrieve information about the specified multicast address range.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<multicastRange>
  <id>5</id>
  <name>239.0.0.0-239.255.255.255</name>
  <begin>239.0.0.0</begin>
  <end>239.255.255.255</end>
  <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
  <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
</multicastRange>

PUT /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts/{multicastAddresssRangeId}

Update the specified multicast address range.

If the multicast address range is universal you must send the API request to the primary NSX Manager.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="multicastRange">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="desc"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="end"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<multicastRange>
  <name>Extended range 2</name>
  <desc>Extended range 2</desc>
  <end>238.255.255.255</end>
</multicastRange>

DELETE /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts/{multicastAddresssRangeId}

Delete the specified multicast address range.

If the multicast address range is universal you must send the API request to the primary NSX Manager.

Security

  • basic

/2.0/vdn/config/resources/allocated

Working with allocated resources.

GET /2.0/vdn/config/resources/allocated

Retrieve information about allocated segment IDs or multicast addresses.

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

type string

set to segmentId or multicastAddress

pagesize string

The number of results to return. Range is 1-1024.

startindex string

The starting point for returning results.

/2.0/vdn/config/segments

Working with segment ID pools.

Segment ID pools (also called segment ID ranges) provide virtual network identifiers (VNIs) to logical switches.

You must configure a segment ID pool for each NSX Manager. You can have more than one segment ID pool. The segment ID pool includes the beginning and ending IDs.

You should not configure more than 10,000 VNIs in a single vCenter server because vCenter limits the number of dvPortgroups to 10,000.

If any of your transport zones will use multicast or hybrid replication mode, you must also configure a multicast address range.

POST /2.0/vdn/config/segments

Add a segment ID pool.

  • name - Required property.
  • desc - Optional property.
  • begin - Required property. Minimum value is 5000
  • end - Required property. Maximum value is 16777216

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

isUniversal boolean

Set to true when creating a universal segment ID pool.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="segmentRange">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="begin"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="end"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<segmentRange>
  <name>Segment 1</name>
  <desc>Segment Range 1</desc>
  <begin>5000</begin>
  <end>12999</end>
</segmentRange>

GET /2.0/vdn/config/segments

Retrieve information about all segment ID pools.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<segmentRanges>
  <segmentRange>
    <id>1</id>
    <name>Local Segments</name>
    <desc>Local Segment ID pool</desc>
    <begin>5000</begin>
    <end>5999</end>
    <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
    <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
  </segmentRange>
  <segmentRange>
    <id>3</id>
    <name>Universal-Segments</name>
    <desc>Universal segment ID pool</desc>
    <begin>200000</begin>
    <end>201000</end>
    <isUniversal>true</isUniversal>
    <universalRevision>2</universalRevision>
  </segmentRange>
</segmentRanges>

/2.0/vdn/config/segments/{segmentPoolId}

Working With a Specific Segment ID Pool

URI Parameters

segmentPoolId string required

A valid segmentPoolId

GET /2.0/vdn/config/segments/{segmentPoolId}

Retrieve information about the specified segment ID pool.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<segmentRange>
  <id>1</id>
  <name>Local Segments</name>
  <desc>Local Segment ID pool</desc>
  <begin>5000</begin>
  <end>5999</end>
  <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
  <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
</segmentRange>

PUT /2.0/vdn/config/segments/{segmentPoolId}

Update the specified segment ID pool.

If the segment ID pool is universal you must send the API request to the primary NSX Manager.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="segmentRange">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="end"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<segmentRange>
  <desc>Local Segment ID pool expanded</desc>
  <end>6999</end>
</segmentRange>

DELETE /2.0/vdn/config/segments/{segmentPoolId}

Delete the specified segment ID pool.

If the segment ID pool is universal you must send the API request to the primary NSX Manager.

Security

  • basic

/2.0/vdn/config/vxlan/udp/port

Working with the VXLAN port configuration.

GET /2.0/vdn/config/vxlan/udp/port

Retrieve the UDP port configured for VXLAN traffic.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<int>4789</int>

/2.0/vdn/config/vxlan/udp/port/taskStatus

VXLAN port configuration update status.

GET /2.0/vdn/config/vxlan/udp/port/taskStatus

Retrieve the status of the VXLAN port configuration update.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<vxlanPortUpdatingStatus>
  <prevPort>8472</prevPort>
  <targetPort>4789</targetPort>
  <taskPhase>PHASE_TWO</taskPhase>
  <taskStatus>PAUSED</taskStatus>
</vxlanPortUpdatingStatus>

/2.0/vdn/config/vxlan/udp/port/{portNumber}

Update the VXLAN port configuration.

URI Parameters

portNumber string required

A valid UDP port for VXLAN

PUT /2.0/vdn/config/vxlan/udp/port/{portNumber}

Update the VXLAN port configuration to use port portNumber.

This method changes the VXLAN port in a three phrase process, avoiding disruption of VXLAN traffic. In a cross-vCenter NSX environment, change the VXLAN port on the primary NSX Manager to propagate this change on all NSX Managers and hosts in the cross-vCenter NSX environment.

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

force boolean

Set to true to force the change in VXLAN port.

This updates the port configuration on the hosts directly, and might cause a disruption in VXLAN traffic. In a cross-vCenter NSX environment, this does not change the port on all NSX Managers.

/2.0/vdn/controller

Working with NSX controllers - For the unicast or hybrid control plane mode, you must add an NSX controller to manage overlay transport and provide East-West routing. The controller optimizes virtual machine broadcast (ARP only) traffic, and the learning is stored on the host and the controller.

POST /2.0/vdn/controller

Adds a new NSX controller on the specified given cluster. The hostId parameter is optional. The resourcePoolId can be either the clusterId or resourcePoolId.

The IP address of the controller node will be allocated from the specified IP pool. The deployType property determines the controller node memory size and can be small, medium, or large. However, different controller deployment types are not currently supported because the OVF overrides it and different OVF types require changes in the manager build scripts. Despite not being supported, an arbitrary deployType size must still be specified or an error will be returned. Request without body to upgrade controller cluster.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="controllerSpec">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipPoolId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="resourcePoolId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="datastoreId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="deployType"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="networkId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<controllerSpec>
  <name></name>
  <description></description>
  <ipPoolId></ipPoolId>
  <resourcePoolId></resourcePoolId>
  <hostId></hostId>
  <datastoreId></datastoreId>
  <deployType></deployType>
  <networkId></networkId>
  <password></password>
</controllerSpec>

GET /2.0/vdn/controller

Retrieves details and runtime status for all controllers. Runtime status can be one of the following:

  • Deploying ‐ controller is being deployed and the procedure has not completed yet.
  • Removing ‐ controller is being removed and the procedure has not completed yet.
  • Running ‐ controller has been deployed and can respond to API invocation.
  • Unknown ‐ controller has been deployed but fails to respond to API invocation.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<controllers>
  <controller>
    <id></id>
    <name></name>
    <description></description>
    <ipAddress></ipAddress>
    <status></status>
  </controller>
</controllers>

/2.0/vdn/controller/cluster

Cluster configuration

GET /2.0/vdn/controller/cluster

Retrieve cluster wide configuration information for controller.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<controllerConfig>
  <sslEnabled></sslEnabled>
</controllerConfig>

PUT /2.0/vdn/controller/cluster

Modify cluster wide configuration information for controller

Security

  • basic

      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="sslEnabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<controllerConfig>
  <sslEnabled></sslEnabled>
</controllerConfig>

  </xs:element>

  <apiPassword></apiPassword>
</controllerCredential>

Status of controller creation or removal

URI Parameters

jobId string required

Specified job Id

GET /2.0/vdn/controller/progress/{jobId}

Retrieves status of controller creation or removal. The progress gives a percentage indication of current deploy / remove procedure.

/2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}

Working with specified controller

URI Parameters

Specified controller

DELETE /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}

Deletes NSX controller. When deleting the last controller from a cluster, the parameter forceRemovalForLast must be set to true.

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

forceRemoval boolean required

Force removal of controller (true/false)

/2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/snapshot

Take a snapshot of the control cluster from the specified controller node.

GET /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/snapshot

To retrieve the controller IDs, log in to the vSphere Web Client. Navigate to Networking & Security > Installation. The NSX Controller Nodes table lists the controller IDs (Name column) and IP addresses (Node column) of each controller.

Security

  • basic

/2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/syslog

Configures a syslog exporter on the specified controller node.

POST /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/syslog

Add controller syslog exporter on the controller

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="controllerSyslogServer">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="syslogServer"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="protocol"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="level"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<controllerSyslogServer>
  <syslogServer></syslogServer>
  <port></port>
  <protocol></protocol>
  <level></level>
</controllerSyslogServer>

GET /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/syslog

Security

  • basic

<controllerSyslogServer>
  <syslogServer></syslogServer>
  <port></port>
  <protocol></protocol>
  <level></level>
</controllerSyslogServer>

DELETE /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/syslog

Security

  • basic

/2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/techsupportlogs

Controller logs

GET /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/techsupportlogs

Retrieves controller logs. Response content type is application/octet-stream and response header is filename. This streams a fairly large bundle back (possibly hundreds of MB).

Security

  • basic

/2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways

bfdEnabled is true by default.

<hardwareGatewaySpec>
  <name></name>
  <description></description>
  <certificate></certificate>
  <bfdEnabled></bfdEnabled>
</hardwareGatewaySpec>

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<list>
    <hardwareGateway>
      <objectId>torgateway-1</objectId>
      <revision>0</revision>
      <name>torgateway1</name>
      <description>this is tor instance 1</description>
      <clientHandle />
      <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
      <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
      <uuid>6536bcf5-2f55-47f6-8b26-9fa632061d8c</uuid>
      <status>UP</status>
      <thumbprint>B9:0E:E9:6C:AA:7B:AD:11:64:4C:33:92:4E:0C:D8:16:10:95:02:A7</thumbprint>
      <bfdEnabled>true</bfdEnabled>
      <managementIp>10.116.255.160</managementIp>
      <bindingCount>2</bindingCount>
    </hardwareGateway>
    <hardwareGateway>
      <objectId>torgateway-2</objectId>
      <revision>0</revision>
      <name>torgateway2</name>
      <description>this is tor instance 2</description>
      <clientHandle />
      <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
      <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
      <uuid>f1e9b733-c0c3-4905-b00d-4bd6d8649f48</uuid>
      <status>UP</status>
      <thumbprint>3C:9D:C0:9B:F7:57:AF:EA:6A:9F:49:27:7B:23:25:D3:5E:0D:53:ED</thumbprint>
      <bfdEnabled>true</bfdEnabled>
      <managementIp>10.116.251.149</managementIp>
      <bindingCount>2</bindingCount>
    </hardwareGateway>
</list>

/2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/bindings

Retrieve information about hardware gateway bindings.

POST /2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/bindings

Create a hardware gateway binding.

Security

  • basic

Request Example (application/xml)

<hardwareGatewayBinding>
  <hardwareGatewayId></hardwareGatewayId>
  <vlan></vlan>
  <switchName></switchName>
  <portName></portName>
</hardwareGatewayBinding>

GET /2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/bindings

Retrieve information about hardware gateway bindings.

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

hardwareGatewayId string

ID of the hardware gateway.

vni integer

VNI of the logical switch.

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<hardwareGatewayBinding>
  <id>hardware gateway binding id</id>
  <hardwareGatewayId>hwgateway1</hardwareGatewayId>
  <vlan>201</vlan>
  <switchName>s1</switchName>
  <portname>s1</portname>
  <virtualWire>virtualwire-1</virtualWire>
  <vni>5000</vni>
</hardwareGatewayBinding>

/2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/bindings/manage

Working with hardware gateway binding objects.

POST /2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/bindings/manage

Manage hardware gateway binding objects.

Use this API to attach, detach, and update multiple bindings in a single API call. This API accepts three lists for add, update, and delete. Each list accepts a hardwareGatewayManageBindingsItem with a full description of the new binding with its objectID. This API handles a maximum of 100 HardwareGatewayManageBindingsItem objects for each of the Add/Update/Delete lists.

Security

  • basic

Request Example (application/xml)

<hardwareGatewayManageBindings>
  <addItems>
    <hardwareGatewayManageBindingItem>
      <hardwareGatewayId></hardwareGatewayId>
      <virtualWireId></virtualWireId>
      <switchName></switchName>
      <portname></portname>
      <vlan></vlan>
      <virtualWire></virtualWire>
    </ hardwareGatewayManageBindingItem>
  </addItems>
  <updateItems>
    <hardwareGatewayManageBindingItem>
      <objectId></objectId>
      <hardwareGatewayId></hardwareGatewayId>
      <virtualWireId></virtualWireId>
      <switchName></switchName>
      <portname></portname>
      <vlan></vlan>
      <virtualWire></virtualWire>
    </hardwareGatewayManageBindingItem>
  </updateItems>
  <deleteItems>
    <hardwareGatewayManageBindingItem>
      <objectId></objectId>
    </ hardwareGatewayManageBindingItem>
  </deleteItems>
<hardwareGatewayManageBindings>

/2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/bindings/{bindingId}

Working with a specific hardware gateway binding.

URI Parameters

bindingId string required

hardware gateway binding ID.

GET /2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/bindings/{bindingId}

Retrieve information about the specified hardware gateway binding.

Security

  • basic

PUT /2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/bindings/{bindingId}

Update the specified hardware gateway binding.

You can update the binding parameters. This API will fail if:

  • the specified hardwareGatewayId does not exist.
  • the specified logical switch (virtualWire) is not present or there is a software gateway on the binding.
  • the new binding value is a duplicate of an existing binding.

Security

  • basic

Request Example (application/xml)

<hardwareGatewayBinding>
  <hardwareGatewayId>hardwaregateway1</hardwareGatewayId>
  <vlan>201</vlan>
  <switchName>s1</switchName>
  <portname>s1</portname>
  <virtualWire>virtualwire-1</virtualWire>
</hardwareGatewayBinding>

DELETE /2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/bindings/{bindingId}

Delete the specified hardware gateway binding.

Security

  • basic

/2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/bindings/{bindingId}/statistic

Working with hardware gateway binding statistics.

GET /2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/bindings/{bindingId}/statistic

Retrieve statistics for the specified hardware gateway binding.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<hardwareGatewayStats>
  <bindingId>hwgwbinding-5</bindingId>
  <timestamp>long type timestamp for this query response</timestamp>
  <packetsFromLocal>23431</packetsFromLocal>
  <bytesFromLocal>734754</bytesFromLocal>
  <packetsToLocal>2343</packetsToLocal>
  <bytesToLocal>74364</bytesToLocal>
</hardwareGatewayStats>

/2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/replicationcluster

Working with the hardware gateway replication cluster.

PUT /2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/replicationcluster

Update the hardware gateway replication cluster.

Add or remove hosts on a replication cluster.

Security

  • basic

Request Example (appplication/xml)

<replicationCluster>
  <hosts>
    <basicinfo>
      <objectId>host-20</objectId>
    </basicinfo>
    <basicinfo>
      <objectId>host-21</objectId>
    </basicinfo>
    <basicinfo>
      <objectId>host-26</objectId>
    </basicinfo>
  </hosts>
</replicationCluster>

GET /2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/replicationcluster

Retrieve information about the hardware gateway replication cluster.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<replicationCluster>
  <hosts>
    <basicinfo>
      <objectId>host-26</objectId>
      <objectTypeName>HostSystem</objectTypeName>
      <vsmUuid>422874E3-6873-972C-DE9E-67D5B846042E</vsmUuid>
      <nodeId>e5a97efd-89e1-44b1-bfe8-9d07a8d92f08</nodeId>
      <revision>32</revision>
      <type>
        <typeName>HostSystem</typeName>
      </type>
      <name>10.116.254.9</name>
      <scope>
        <id>domain-c24</id>

        <name>ComputeCluster2-$$</name>
      </scope>
      <clientHandle />
      <extendedAttributes />
      <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
      <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
    </basicinfo>
    <basicinfo>
      <objectId>host-21</objectId>
      <objectTypeName>HostSystem</objectTypeName>
      <vsmUuid>422874E3-6873-972C-DE9E-67D5B846042E</vsmUuid>
      <nodeId>e5a97efd-89e1-44b1-bfe8-9d07a8d92f08</nodeId>

      </type>

        <name>ComputeCluster1-$$</name>
      </scope>

      <extendedAttributes />
      <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
      <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
    </basicinfo>

      <objectId>host-20</objectId>
      <objectTypeName>HostSystem</objectTypeName>
      <vsmUuid>422874E3-6873-972C-DE9E-67D5B846042E</vsmUuid>
      <nodeId>e5a97efd-89e1-44b1-bfe8-9d07a8d92f08</nodeId>

        <typeName>HostSystem</typeName>
      </type>
      <name>10.116.254.157</name>

        <id>domain-c18</id>

        <name>ComputeCluster1-$$</name>
      </scope>
      <clientHandle />
      <extendedAttributes />
      <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
      <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
    </basicinfo>
  </hosts>
</replicationCluster>

/2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/{hardwareGatewayId}

Working with a specific hardware gateway.

URI Parameters

Object ID of the hardware gateway.

GET /2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/{hardwareGatewayId}

Retrieve information about the specified hardware gateway.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<hardwareGateway>
  <objectId>torgateway-1</objectId>
  <revision>0</revision>
  <name>torgateway1</name>
  <description>this is tor instance 1</description>
  <clientHandle />
  <isUniversal>false</isUniversal>
  <universalRevision>0</universalRevision>
  <uuid>6536bcf5-2f55-47f6-8b26-9fa632061d8c</uuid>
  <status>UP</status>
  <thumbprint>B9:0E:E9:6C:AA:7B:AD:11:64:4C:33:92:4E:0C:D8:16:10:95:02:A7</thumbprint>
  <bfdEnabled>true</bfdEnabled>
  <managementIp>10.116.255.160</managementIp>
  <bindingCount>2</bindingCount>
</hardwareGateway>

PUT /2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/{hardwareGatewayId}

Update the specified hardware gateway.

Security

  • basic

Request Example (application/xml)

<hardwareGatewaySpec>
  <name></name>
  <description></description>
  <certificate></certificate>
  <bfdEnabled></bfdEnabled>
</hardwareGatewaySpec>

Security

  • basic

/2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/{hardwareGatewayId}/switches

/2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/{hardwareGatewayId}/switches/{switchName}

URI Parameters

switchName string required

/2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/{hardwareGatewayId}/switches/{switchName}/switchports

Working with ports on a specific switch on a specific hardware gateway.

GET /2.0/vdn/hardwaregateways/{hardwareGatewayId}/switches/{switchName}/switchports
