/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/routing/config/ospf

OSPF Routing for NSX Edge

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/routing/config/ospf

Query OSPF config

Security

  • basic

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/routing/config/ospf

Configure OSPF

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ospf">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
        <xs:element name="ospfAreas">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="ospfArea">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="areaId"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                    <xs:element name="authentication">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="ospfInterfaces">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="ospfInterface">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vnic"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="areaId"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="helloInterval"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="deadInterval"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="priority"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="cost"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="redistribution">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
              <xs:element name="rules">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="rule">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="prefixName"/>
                          <xs:element name="from">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isis"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ospf"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="bgp"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="static"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="connected"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="action"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<ospf>
  <enabled></enabled>
  <ospfAreas>
    <ospfArea>
      <areaId></areaId>
      <type></type>
      <authentication>
        <type></type>
        <value></value>
      </authentication>
    </ospfArea>
  </ospfAreas>
  <ospfInterfaces>
    <ospfInterface>
      <vnic></vnic>
      <areaId></areaId>
      <helloInterval></helloInterval>
      <deadInterval></deadInterval>
      <priority></priority>
      <cost></cost>
    </ospfInterface>
  </ospfInterfaces>
  <redistribution>
    <enabled></enabled>
    <rules>
      <rule>
        <prefixName></prefixName>
        <from>
          <isis></isis>
          <ospf></ospf>
          <bgp></bgp>
          <static></static>
          <connected></connected>
        </from>
        <action></action>
      </rule>
    </rules>
  </redistribution>
</ospf>

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/routing/config/ospf

Delete OSPF routing

Security

  • basic

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/routing/config/static

Static and default routes for specified Edge

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/routing/config/static

Read static and default routes

Security

  • basic

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/routing/config/static

Configure static and default routes

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="staticRouting">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="staticRoutes">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="route">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vnic"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="network"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="nextHop"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="mtu"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="defaultRoute">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="vnic"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="gatewayAddress"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="mtu"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<staticRouting>
  <staticRoutes>
    <route>
      <description></description>
      <vnic></vnic>
      <network></network>
      <nextHop></nextHop>
      <mtu></mtu>
    </route>
  </staticRoutes>
  <defaultRoute>
    <description></description>
    <vnic></vnic>
    <gatewayAddress></gatewayAddress>
    <mtu></mtu>
  </defaultRoute>
</staticRouting>

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/routing/config/static

Delete both static and default routing config stored in the NSX Mgr database

Security

  • basic

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/activesessions

Working with active clients

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/activesessions

Retrieve a list of active clients for the SSL VPN session

Security

  • basic

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/activesessions/{sessionID}

Specified client session

URI Parameters

sessionID string required

Specified client session

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/activesessions/{sessionID}

Disconnect an active client

Security

  • basic

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/auth/localusers/users

All users of NSX Edge

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/auth/localusers/users

Update all users with the given list of users. If the user is present, it is updated. Otherwise, and new user is created. Existing users not included in the body are deleted.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="users">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="user">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="firstName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="lastName"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="disableUserAccount"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passwordNeverExpires"/>
              <xs:element name="allowChangePassword">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="changePasswordOnNextLogin"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<users>
  <user>
    <userId></userId>
    <password></password>
    <firstName></firstName>
    <lastName></lastName>
    <description></description>
    <disableUserAccount></disableUserAccount>
    <passwordNeverExpires></passwordNeverExpires>
    <allowChangePassword>
      <changePasswordOnNextLogin></changePasswordOnNextLogin>
    </allowChangePassword>
  </user>
</users>

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config

Manage SSL VPN

POST /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config

Enable or disable SSL VPN

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

enableService boolean required

Set to true to enable, false to disable

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config

Retrieve SSL VPN details

Security

  • basic

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config

Reconfigure the entire SSL VPN

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="logonLogoffScript">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="logonLogoffScript">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="objectId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="scriptFileId"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<logonLogoffScript>
  <logonLogoffScript>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <scriptFileId></scriptFileId>
    <type></type>
    <enabled></enabled>
    <description></description>
  </logonLogoffScript>
</logonLogoffScript>

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config

Security

  • basic

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/advancedconfig

SSL VPN advanced configuration

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/advancedconfig

Retrieve SSL VPN advanced configuration

Security

  • basic

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/advancedconfig

Apply advanced configuration

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="advancedConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enableCompression"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="forceVirtualKeyboard"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="preventMultipleLogon"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="randomizeVirtualkeys"/>
        <xs:element name="timeout">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="forcedTimeout"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="sessionIdleTimeout"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="clientNotification"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enablePublicUrlAccess"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enableLogging"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<advancedConfig>
  <enableCompression></enableCompression>
  <forceVirtualKeyboard></forceVirtualKeyboard>
  <preventMultipleLogon></preventMultipleLogon>
  <randomizeVirtualkeys></randomizeVirtualkeys>
  <timeout>
    <forcedTimeout></forcedTimeout>
    <sessionIdleTimeout></sessionIdleTimeout>
  </timeout>
  <clientNotification></clientNotification>
  <enablePublicUrlAccess></enablePublicUrlAccess>
  <enableLogging></enableLogging>
</advancedConfig>

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/auth/localserver/users

Portal users

POST /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/auth/localserver/users

Add a new portal user

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="user">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="firstName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="lastName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="disableUserAccount"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passwordNeverExpires"/>
        <xs:element name="allowChangePassword">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="changePasswordOnNextLogin"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<user>
  <userId></userId>
  <password></password>
  <firstName></firstName>
  <lastName></lastName>
  <description></description>
  <disableUserAccount></disableUserAccount>
  <passwordNeverExpires></passwordNeverExpires>
  <allowChangePassword>
    <changePasswordOnNextLogin></changePasswordOnNextLogin>
  </allowChangePassword>
</user>

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/auth/localserver/users

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="user">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="userId"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="password"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="firstName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="lastName"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="disableUserAccount"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passwordNeverExpires"/>
        <xs:element name="allowChangePassword">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="changePasswordOnNextLogin"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

  <password></password>
  <firstName></firstName>
  <lastName></lastName>

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/auth/localserver/users/{userID}

URI Parameters

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/auth/localserver/users/{userID}

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/auth/localserver/users/{userID}

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/auth/settings

Authentication settings

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/auth/settings

Get information about authentication server

Security

  • basic

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/auth/settings

Set authentication process for remote users. Specify username/password authentication, active directory, ldap, radius, client certificate based authentication

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="authenticationConfig">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="passwordAuthentication">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="authenticationTimeout"/>
              <xs:element name="primaryAuthServers">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.LdapAuthServerDto">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ip"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="timeOut"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enableSsl"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="searchBase"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="bindDomainName"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="bindPassword"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="loginAttributeName"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="searchFilter"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.RadiusAuthServerDto">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ip"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="timeOut"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="secret"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="nasIp"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="retryCount"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.LocalAuthServerDto">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
                          <xs:element name="passwordPolicy">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="minLength"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="maxLength"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="minAlphabets"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="minDigits"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="minSpecialChar"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="allowUserIdWithinPassword"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="passwordLifeTime"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="expiryNotification"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                          <xs:element name="accountLockoutPolicy">
                            <xs:complexType>
                              <xs:sequence>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="retryCount"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="retryDuration"/>
                                <xs:element type="xs:string" name="lockoutDuration"/>
                              </xs:sequence>
                            </xs:complexType>
                          </xs:element>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element name="com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.RsaAuthServerDto">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="timeOut"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="sourceIp"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="secondaryAuthServer">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.AdAuthServerDto">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ip"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="timeOut"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enableSsl"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="searchBase"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="bindDomainName"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="bindPassword"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="loginAttributeName"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="searchFilter"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="terminateSessionOnAuthFails"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<authenticationConfig>
  <passwordAuthentication>
  <authenticationTimeout></authenticationTimeout>
    <primaryAuthServers>
      <com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.LdapAuthServerDto>
        <ip></ip>
        <port></port>
        <timeOut></timeOut>
        <enableSsl></enableSsl>
        <searchBase></searchBase>
        <bindDomainName></bindDomainName>
        <bindPassword></bindPassword>
        <loginAttributeName></loginAttributeName>
        <searchFilter></searchFilter>
        <enabled></enabled>
      </com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.LdapAuthServerDto>
      <com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.RadiusAuthServerDto>
        <ip></ip>
        <port></port>
        <timeOut></timeOut>
        <secret></secret>
        <nasIp></nasIp>
        <retryCount></retryCount>
      </com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.RadiusAuthServerDto>
      <com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.LocalAuthServerDto>
        <enabled></enabled>
        <passwordPolicy>
          <minLength></minLength>
          <maxLength></maxLength>
          <minAlphabets></minAlphabets>
          <minDigits></minDigits>
          <minSpecialChar></minSpecialChar>
          <allowUserIdWithinPassword></allowUserIdWithinPassword>
          <passwordLifeTime></passwordLifeTime>
          <expiryNotification></expiryNotification>
        </passwordPolicy>
        <accountLockoutPolicy>
          <retryCount></retryCount>
          <retryDuration></retryDuration>
          <lockoutDuration></lockoutDuration>
        </accountLockoutPolicy>
      </com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.LocalAuthServerDto>
      <com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.RsaAuthServerDto>
        <timeOut></timeOut>
        <sourceIp></sourceIp>
      </com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.RsaAuthServerDto>
    </primaryAuthServers>
    <secondaryAuthServer>
      <com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.AdAuthServerDto>
        <ip>1.1.1.1</ip>
        <port>90</port>
        <timeOut>20</timeOut>
        <enableSsl>false</enableSsl>
        <searchBase>searchbasevalue</searchBase>
        <bindDomainName>binddnvalue</bindDomainName>
        <bindPassword>password</bindPassword>
        <loginAttributeName>cain</loginAttributeName>
        <searchFilter>found</searchFilter>
        <terminateSessionOnAuthFails>false</terminateSessionOnAuthFails>
        <enabled>true</enabled>
      </com.vmware.vshield.edge.sslvpn.dto.AdAuthServerDto>
    </secondaryAuthServer>
  </passwordAuthentication>
</authenticationConfig>

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/auth/settings/rsaconfigfile

RSA authentication server, bound to the SSL gateway

POST /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/auth/settings/rsaconfigfile

Upload RSA config file (See "Generate the Authentication Manager Configuration File" section of the RSA Authentication Manager Administrator's guide for instructions on how to configure and download the RSA config file from RSA Authentication Manager)

Security

  • basic

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/clientconfig

Advanced parameters for full access client configurations--such as whether client should auto-reconnect in case of network failures or network unavailability, or whether the client should be uninstalled after logout

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/clientconfig

Set parameters for full access client configurations

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="clientConfiguration">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="autoReconnect"/>
        <xs:element name="fullTunnel">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="excludeLocalSubnets"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="gatewayIp"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="upgradeNotification"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<clientConfiguration>
  <autoReconnect></autoReconnect>
  <fullTunnel>
    <excludeLocalSubnets></excludeLocalSubnets>
    <gatewayIp></gatewayIp>
  </fullTunnel>
  <upgradeNotification></upgradeNotification>
</clientConfiguration>

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/clientconfig

Get client configuration

Security

  • basic

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/installpackages

Installation packages for SSL VPN clients

POST /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/installpackages

Create installers for full access network clients. These setup binaries are downloaded by remote clients and installed on their systems.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="clientInstallPackage">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="profileName"/>
        <xs:element name="gatewayList">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="gateway">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="startClientOnLogon"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hideSystrayIcon"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="rememberPassword"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="silentModeOperation"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="silentModeInstallation"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hideNetworkAdaptor"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="createDesktopIcon"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enforceServerSecurityCertValidation"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="createLinuxClient"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="createMacClient"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<clientInstallPackage>
  <profileName></profileName>
  <gatewayList>
    <gateway>
      <hostName></hostName>
      <port></port>
    </gateway>
  </gatewayList>
  <startClientOnLogon></startClientOnLogon>
  <hideSystrayIcon></hideSystrayIcon>
  <rememberPassword></rememberPassword>
  <silentModeOperation></silentModeOperation>
  <silentModeInstallation></silentModeInstallation>
  <hideNetworkAdaptor></hideNetworkAdaptor>
  <createDesktopIcon></createDesktopIcon>
  <enforceServerSecurityCertValidation></enforceServerSecurityCertValidation>
  <createLinuxClient></createLinuxClient>
  <createMacClient></createMacClient>
  <description></description>
  <enabled></enabled>
</clientInstallPackage>

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/installpackages

Get information about all installation packages

Security

  • basic

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/installpackages

Update all installation packages with the given list. If the package is present, it is updated; otherwise a new installation package is created. Existing packages not included in the body are deleted.

Security

  • basic

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/installpackages

Delete all client installation packages

Security

  • basic

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/installpackages/{packageID}

Specified installation package

URI Parameters

packageID string required

Specified installation package ID

Security

  • basic

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/installpackages/{packageID}

Modify the specified installation package

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="clientInstallPackage">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="profileName"/>
        <xs:element name="gatewayList">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="gateway">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hostName"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="startClientOnLogon"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hideSystrayIcon"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="rememberPassword"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="silentModeOperation"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="silentModeInstallation"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="hideNetworkAdaptor"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="createDesktopIcon"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enforceServerSecurityCertValidation"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="createLinuxClient"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="createMacClient"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<clientInstallPackage>
  <profileName></profileName>
  <gatewayList>
    <gateway>
      <hostName></hostName>
      <port></port>
    </gateway>
  </gatewayList>
  <startClientOnLogon></startClientOnLogon>
  <hideSystrayIcon></hideSystrayIcon>
  <rememberPassword></rememberPassword>
  <silentModeOperation></silentModeOperation>
  <silentModeInstallation></silentModeInstallation>
  <hideNetworkAdaptor></hideNetworkAdaptor>
  <createDesktopIcon></createDesktopIcon>
  <enforceServerSecurityCertValidation></enforceServerSecurityCertValidation>
  <createLinuxClient></createLinuxClient>
  <createMacClient></createMacClient>
  <description></description>
  <enabled></enabled>
</clientInstallPackage>

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/ippools

IP pools to assign IP addresses to remote users

POST /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/ippools

Create an IP pool

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipAddressPool">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipRange"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="netmask"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="gateway"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="primaryDns"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="secondaryDns"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsSuffix"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="winsServer"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<ipAddressPool>
  <description></description>
  <ipRange></ipRange>
  <netmask></netmask>
  <gateway></gateway>
  <primaryDns></primaryDns>
  <secondaryDns></secondaryDns>
  <dnsSuffix></dnsSuffix>
  <winsServer></winsServer>
  <enabled></enabled>
</ipAddressPool>

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/ippools

Security

  • basic

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/ippools

Update all IP pools with the given list of pools. If the pool is present, it is updated; otherwise, a new pool is created. Existing pools not in the body are deleted

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="ipAddressPool">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipRange"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="netmask"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="gateway"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="primaryDns"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="secondaryDns"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="dnsSuffix"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="winsServer"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

  <ipRange></ipRange>
  <netmask></netmask>

</ipAddressPool>

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/privatenetworks

Configure a private network to expose to remote users over SSL VPN tunnel

POST /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/privatenetworks

Add a private network

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="privateNetwork">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="network"/>
        <xs:element name="sendOverTunnel">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ports"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="optimize"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<privateNetwork>
  <description></description>
  <network></network>
  <sendOverTunnel>
    <ports></ports>
    <optimize></optimize>
  </sendOverTunnel>
  <enabled></enabled>
</privateNetwork>

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/client/networkextension/privatenetworks

  • basic

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/server

Configure SSL VPN server on port 443 using the certificate named server-cert that is already uploaded on the NSX Edge appliance and the specified cipher

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/server

Get server settings

Security

  • basic

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/server

Apply server settings

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="serverSettings">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="serverAddresses">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipAddress"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="port"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="certificateId"/>
        <xs:element name="sslVersionList">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="version"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<serverSettings>
  <serverAddresses>
    <ipAddress></ipAddress>
  </serverAddresses>
  <port></port>
  <certificateId></certificateId>
  <sslVersionList>
    <version></version>
  </sslVersionList>
</serverSettings>

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/webresources

Web access server that a remote user can connect to via a web browser

POST /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/sslvpn/config/webresources

Add portal web resource

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="webResource">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="url"/>
        <xs:element name="method">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="data"/>
            </xs:sequence>
            <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="name"/>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="description"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="enabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<webResource>
  <name></name>
  <url></url>
  <method name="">
    <data></data>
  </method>
  <description></description>
  <enabled></enabled>
</webResource>

  • basic

Query Parameters

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/statistics/dashboard/ipsec

Tunnel traffic statistics

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/statistics/dashboard/ipsec

Retrieve tunnel traffic statistics for specified time interval. Default is 1 hour. Other possible values are 1-60 minutes|oneDay| oneWeek|oneMonth|oneYear

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

interval string

Specify a range; can be 1 - 60 minutes, or oneDay|oneWeek| oneMonth|oneYear. Default is 60 minutes

Security

  • basic

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/status

Edge status

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/status

Retrieve the status of the specified Edge

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

getlatest boolean

true = fetch the status live from NSX Edge, false = fetch the latest available status from database

detailed boolean

true = fetch detailed status per feature, false = aggregated summary of status per feature

preRulesStatus boolean

true = fetch detailed output for pre rules in addition to the regular output

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/summary

Edge summary

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/summary

Retrieve details about the specified Edge

Security

  • basic

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/syslog/config

Configure one or two remote syslog servers. Edge events and logs related to firewall events that flow from Edge appliances are sent to the syslog servers

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/syslog/config

Query syslog servers

Security

  • basic

PUT /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/syslog/config

Configure syslog servers

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="syslog">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="protocol"/>
        <xs:element name="serverAddresses">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="ipAddress"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<syslog>
  <protocol></protocol>
  <serverAddresses>
    <ipAddress></ipAddress>
  </serverAddresses>
</syslog>

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/syslog/config

Delete syslog servers

Security

  • basic

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/techsupportlogs

Tech support logs for specified Edge

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/techsupportlogs

Retrieve the tech support logs for Edge

Security

  • basic

/4.0/edges/{edgeId}/vnics

Working with interfaces. Add up to ten internal/uplink interfaces to each Edge. Each Edge must have at least one internal interface

POST /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/vnics

Add an interface or sub interface

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

action string required

always set to "patch"

Request Example (application/xml)

<vnics>
  <vnic>
    <name></name>
    <addressGroups>
      <addressGroup>
        <primaryAddress></primaryAddress>
        <secondaryAddresses>
          <ipAddress></ipAddress>
        </secondaryAddresses>
        <subnetMask></subnetMask>
      </addressGroup>
    </addressGroups>
    <mtu></mtu>
    <type></type>
    <index></index>
    <portgroupId></portgroupId>
    <portgroupName></portgroupName>
    <macAddress>
      <edgeVmHaIndex></edgeVmHaIndex>
      <value></value>
    </macAddress>
    <fenceParameter>
      <key></key>
      <value></value>
    </fenceParameter>
    <enableProxyArp></enableProxyArp>
    <enableSendRedirects></enableSendRedirects>
    <enableBridgeMode></enableBridgeMode>
    <isConnected></isConnected>
    <inShapingPolicy>
      <averageBandwidth></averageBandwidth>
      <peakBandwidth></peakBandwidth>
      <burstSize></burstSize>
      <enabled></enabled>
      <inherited></inherited>
    </inShapingPolicy>
    <outShapingPolicy>
      <averageBandwidth></averageBandwidth>
      <peakBandwidth></peakBandwidth>
      <burstSize></burstSize>
      <enabled></enabled>
      <inherited></inherited>
    </outShapingPolicy>
  </vnic>
</vnics>

GET /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/vnics

Security

  • basic

        </secondaryAddresses>
        <subnetMask></subnetMask>
      </addressGroup>
    </addressGroups>
    <mtu></mtu>
    <type></type>
    <index></index>
    <portgroupId></portgroupId>
    <portgroupName></portgroupName>
    <macAddress>
      <edgeVmHaIndex></edgeVmHaIndex>
      <value></value>
    </macAddress>
    <fenceParameter>
      <key></key>
      <value></value>
    </fenceParameter>
    <enableProxyArp></enableProxyArp>
    <enableSendRedirects></enableSendRedirects>
    <enableBridgeMode></enableBridgeMode>
    <isConnected></isConnected>
    <inShapingPolicy>
      <averageBandwidth></averageBandwidth>
      <peakBandwidth></peakBandwidth>
      <burstSize></burstSize>
      <enabled></enabled>
      <inherited></inherited>
    </inShapingPolicy>
    <outShapingPolicy>
      <averageBandwidth></averageBandwidth>
      <peakBandwidth></peakBandwidth>

  </vnic>
</vnics>

DELETE /4.0/edges/{edgeId}/vnics/{index}

Security

  • basic

/4.0/firewall

Working with Distributed Firewall

/4.0/firewall/config/globalconfiguration

Working with the Distributed Firewall Global Configuration

You can use the following parameters to improve firewall performance:

  • layer3RuleOptimize and layer2RuleOptimize to turn on/off rule optimization
  • tcpStrictOption helps in tighter access and forwarding control
  • autoDraftDisable improves performances when making large numbers of changes to firewall rules.

You can disable the auto draft feature by setting autoDraftDisabled to true. Distributed Firewall saves up to 100 configurations, including manually saved drafts ("preserve" field can be set to true or false) and auto saved drafts ("preserve" field is set to false). Once 100 configurations are saved, older drafts with the "preserve" field set to false will be deleted in order to save new configurations. You might want to disable the auto drafts feature before making large numbers of changes to the firewall rules, to improve performance, and to prevent previously saved drafts from being overwritten.

Note: The autoDraftDisabled field does not appear in a GET of the global configuration.

GET /4.0/firewall/config/globalconfiguration

Retrieve performance configuration for distributed firewall.

Security

  • basic

Responses

200 OK

Response Example (application/xml) 
<globalConfiguration>
  <layer3RuleOptimize>false</layer3RuleOptimize>
  <layer2RuleOptimize>true</layer2RuleOptimize>
  <tcpStrictOption>false</tcpStrictOption>
</globalConfiguration>

PUT /4.0/firewall/config/globalconfiguration

Update the distributed firewall performance configuration.

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="globalConfiguration">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:boolean" name="layer3RuleOptimize"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:boolean" name="layer2RuleOptimize"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:boolean" name="tcpStrictOption"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:boolean" name="autoDraftDisabled"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<globalConfiguration>
  <layer3RuleOptimize>false</layer3RuleOptimize>
  <layer2RuleOptimize>true</layer2RuleOptimize>
  <tcpStrictOption>false</tcpStrictOption>
  <autoDraftDisabled>true</autoDraftDisabled>
</globalConfiguration>

/4.0/firewall/forceSync/{ID}

Synchronize hosts and clusters with the last good configuration in NSX Mgr database

URI Parameters

ID string required

Specified host or cluster to synchronize

POST /4.0/firewall/forceSync/{ID}

Force sync host/cluster

Security

  • basic

/4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config

Distributed firewall rules configuration

The following table lists the elements that can be used in firewall rules.

Element Keyword for API Used in
All Edges ALL_EDGES appliedTo
application Application service
application group ApplicationGroup service
cluster compute resource ClusterComputeResource
appliedTo
datacenter Datacenter source/destination
appliedTo
distributed firewall DISTRIBUTED_FIREWALL appliedTo
distributed virtual port group DistributedVirtualPortgroup source/destination
appliedTo
Edge ID Edge appliedTo
global root GlobalRoot source/destination
host HostSystem appliedTo
IP set IPSet source/destination
IPv4 addresses Ipv4Address source/destination
IPv6 addresses Ipv6Address source/destination
logical switch VirtualWire source/destination
appliedTo
MAC set MACSet source/destination
network Network for legacy portgroups, network can be used in source or destination instead of appliedTo
profile ALL_PROFILE_BINDINGS
resource pool ResourcePool source/destination
security group SecurityGroup source/destination
virtual app VirtualApp source/destination
virtual machine VirtualMachine source/destination
appliedTo
vNIC Vnic source/destination
appliedTo

GET /4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config

Retrieve distributed firewall rule configuration.

If no query parameters are used, all rule configuration is retrieved. Use the query parameters to filter the rule configuration information.

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

ruleType string

ruleType can be LAYER3, LAYER2, L3REDIRECT. ruleType is mandatory if other query parameters are sent. Note: Filtering is not supported for layer 2 rules, so specifying LAYER2 will return all rule types.

source string

source can contain IPv4/v6 address or vm‐id

destination string

destination can contain IPv4/v6 address or vm‐id

ruleId string

filter by ruleId

comment string

comment can contain any portion of the comment entered for the rules. Search is case insensitive.

name string

name can contain any portion of the rule name entered for the rules. Search is case insensitive.

siProfile string

siProfile can contain any portion of the service profile name associated with L3 redirect rule. Search is case insensitive.

edgeId string

Filter for rules applicable to the Edge specified by edgeId.

action string

Filter for specific action (allow, deny)

Request Example (application/xml)

<firewallConfiguration timestamp="1360144793284">
  <contextId>globalroot-0</contextId>
  <layer3Sections>
    <section id="2" name="defaultSectionLayer3" generationNumber="1360144793284" timestamp="1360144793284">
      <rule id="2" disabled="false" logged="false">
        <name>Default Rule</name>
        <action>DENY</action>
        <appliedToList>
          <appliedTo>
            <name>DISTRIBUTED_FIREWALL</name>
            <value>DISTRIBUTED_FIREWALL</value>
            <type>DISTRIBUTED_FIREWALL</type>
            <isValid>true</isValid>
          </appliedTo>
        </appliedToList>
        <sectionId>2</sectionId>
      </rule>
    </section>
  </layer3Sections>
  <layer2Sections>
    <section id="1" name="defaultSectionLayer2" generationNumber="1360144793284" timestamp="1360144793284">
      <rule id="1" disabled="false" logged="false">
        <name>Default Rule</name>
        <action>ALLOW</action>
        <appliedToList>
          <appliedTo>
            <name>DISTRIBUTED_FIREWALL</name>
            <value>DISTRIBUTED_FIREWALL</value>
            <type>DISTRIBUTED_FIREWALL</type>
            <isValid>true</isValid>
          </appliedTo>
        </appliedToList>
        <sectionId>1</sectionId>
      </rule>
    </section>
  </layer2Sections>
</firewallConfiguration>

PUT /4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config

Update the complete firewall configuration in all sections.

  • Retrieve the configuration with GET /api/4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config.
  • Retrieve the Etag value from the response headers.
  • Extract and modify the configuration from the response body as needed.
  • Set the If-Match header to the Etag value, and submit the request.

Not all fields are required while sending the request. All the optional fields are safe to be ignored while sending the configuration to server. For example, if an IP set is referenced in the rule only IPSet and Type is needed in the Source/Destination objects and not Name and isValid tags.

When updating the firewall configuration:

  • IDs for new objects (rule/section) should be removed or set to zero.
  • If new entities (sections/rules) have been sent in the request, the response will contain the system-generated IDs, which are assigned to these new entities.
  • appliedTo can be any valid firewall rule element.
  • action can be ALLOW, BLOCK, or REJECT. REJECT sends reject message for unaccepted packets; RST packets are sent for TCP connections and ICMP unreachable code packets are sent for UDP, ICMP, and other IP connections
  • source and destination can have an exclude flag. For example, if you add an exclude tag for 1.1.1.1 in the source parameter, the rule looks for traffic originating from all IPs other than 1.1.1.1.

Security

  • basic

Request Headers

If-Match string required

The Etag value from the response headers from a GET of the firewall configuration you want to modify.

Request Example (application/xml)

<firewallConfiguration timestamp="1359979620727">
  <contextId>globalroot-0</contextId>
  <layer3Sections>
    <section id="2" name="defaultSectionLayer3" generationNumber="1359979620727" timestamp="1359979620727">
      <rule disabled="false" logged="true">
        <name>okn-1</name>
        <action>ALLOW</action>
        <sources excluded="false">
          <source>
            <value>datacenter-57</value>
            <type>Datacenter</type>
          </source>
          <source>
            <value>domain-c62</value>
            <type>ClusterComputeResource</type>
          </source>
          <source>
            <value>10.112.1.1</value>
            <type>Ipv4Address</type>
          </source>
        </sources>
        <services>
          <service>
            <destinationPort>80</destinationPort>
            <protocol>6</protocol>
            <subProtocol>6</subProtocol>
          </service>
          <service>
            <value>application-161</value>
            <type>Application</type>
          </service>
        </services>
        <appliedToList>
          <appliedTo>
            <value>5013bcd8-c666-1e28-c7a9-600da945954f.000</value>
            <type>Vnic</type>
          </appliedTo>
          <appliedTo>
            <value>vm-126</value>
            <type>VirtualMachine</type>
          </appliedTo>
        </appliedToList>
      </rule>
      <rule disabled="true" logged="true">
        <name>Matru-1</name>
        <action>ALLOW</action>
        <sectionId>2</sectionId>
      </rule>
      <rule disabled="true" logged="true">
        <name>Matru-2</name>
        <action>ALLOW</action>
        <sectionId>2</sectionId>
      </rule>
      <rule disabled="true" logged="true">
        <name>Matru-3</name>
        <action>ALLOW</action>
        <sectionId>2</sectionId>
      </rule>
      <rule id="2" disabled="true" logged="false">
        <name>Default Rule</name>
        <action>DENY</action>
        <sectionId>2</sectionId>
      </rule>
    </section>
  </layer3Sections>
  <layer2Sections>
    <section id="1" name="defaultSectionLayer2" generationNumber="1359979620727" timestamp="1359979620727">
      <rule id="1" disabled="false" logged="false">
        <name>Default Rule</name>
        <action>ALLOW</action>
        <sectionId>1</sectionId>
      </rule>
    </section>
  </layer2Sections>
</firewallConfiguration>

DELETE /4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config

Restore default configuration.

Restores a configuration with one defaultLayer3 section with default allow rule and one defaultLayer2Section with default allow rule.

Security

  • basic

/4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer2sections

Working with layer 2 sections in distributed firewall.

You can use sections in the firewall table to group logical rules based on AppliedTo or for a tenant use case. A firewall section is the smallest unit of configuration which can be updated independently. Section types are as follows:

  • Layer3Section contains layer3 rules
  • Layer2Section contains layer2 rules
  • Layer3RedirectSection contains traffic redirect rules.

When Distributed Firewall is used with Service Composer, firewall sections created by Service Composer contain an additional attribute in the XML called managedBy. You should not modify Service Composer firewall sections using Distributed Firewall REST APIs.

GET /4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer2sections

Retrieve rules from the layer 2 section specified by section name.

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

name string

Name of the Section to read

POST /4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer2sections

Create a layer 2 distributed firewall section.

By default, the section is created at the top of the firewall table. You can specify a location for the section with the operation and anchorId query parameters.

Security

  • basic

Query Parameters

operation string

operation can be insert_after, insert_before, insert_top, or insert_before_default.

anchorId string

Specify the section ID to use for reference with insert_before or insert_after operations.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="section">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="rule" maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0">
          <xs:complexType mixed="true">
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="action"/>
              <xs:element name="appliedToList" minOccurs="0">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="appliedTo">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isValid"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="sources" minOccurs="0">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="source">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isValid"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                  <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="excluded"/>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="destinations" minOccurs="0">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="destination">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isValid"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                  <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="excluded"/>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="services" minOccurs="0">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="service">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="destinationPort"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="protocol"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="subProtocol"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
            <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="disabled" use="optional"/>
            <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="logged" use="optional"/>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
      <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="name"/>
      <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="managedBy"/>
      <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="type"/>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<section name="" managedBy="" type="">
  <rule disabled="" logged="">
    <name></name>
    <action></action>
    <appliedToList>
      <appliedTo>
        <name></name>
        <value></value>
        <type></type>
        <isValid></isValid>
      </appliedTo>
    </appliedToList>
    <sources excluded="">
      <source>
        <name></name>
        <value></value>
        <type></type>
        <isValid></isValid>
      </source>
    </sources>
    <destinations excluded="">
      <destination>
        <name></name>
        <value></value>
        <type></type>
        <isValid></isValid>
      </destination>
    </destinations>
    <services>
      <service>
        <destinationPort></destinationPort>
        <protocol></protocol>
        <subProtocol></subProtocol>
      </service>
    </services>
</section>

/4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer2sections/{sectionId}

Working with a specific layer 2 distributed firewall section.

URI Parameters

sectionId string required

The ID of the section to modify.

GET /4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer2sections/{sectionId}

Retrieve information about the specified layer 2 section.

Security

  • basic

POST /4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer2sections/{sectionId}

Move the specified layer 2 section.

Security

  • basic

Request Headers

If-Match string required

The Etag value from the response headers from a GET of the firewall configuration you want to modify.

Query Parameters

action string required

Set action to revise to change the position of the firewall rule section.

operation string

operation can be insert_after, insert_before, insert_top, or insert_before_default.

anchorId string

Specify the section ID to use for reference with insert_before or insert_after operations.

Request Example (application/xml)

POST /api/4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer2sections/1009?action=revise&operation=insert_before&anchorId=1008
If-Match: 1478307787160

<section id="1009" name="Test Section" generationNumber="1478307787160" timestamp="1478307787160" type="LAYER2">
  ...
</section>

PUT /4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer2sections/{sectionId}

Update the specified layer 2 section in distributed firewall.

  • Retrieve the configuration for the specified section.
  • Retrieve the Etag value from the response headers.
  • Extract and modify the configuration from the response body as needed.
  • Set the If-Match header to the Etag value, and submit the request.

Not all fields are required while sending the request. All the optional fields are safe to be ignored while sending the configuration to server. For example, if an IP set is referenced in the rule only IPSet and Type is needed in the Source/Destination objects and not Name and isValid tags.

When updating the firewall configuration:

  • IDs for new objects (rule/section) should be removed or set to zero.
  • If new entities (sections/rules) have been sent in the request, the response will contain the system-generated IDs, which are assigned to these new entities.
  • appliedTo can be any valid firewall rule element.
  • action can be ALLOW, BLOCK, or REJECT. REJECT sends reject message for unaccepted packets; RST packets are sent for TCP connections and ICMP unreachable code packets are sent for UDP, ICMP, and other IP connections
  • source and destination can have an exclude flag. For example, if you add an exclude tag for 1.1.1.1 in the source parameter, the rule looks for traffic originating from all IPs other than 1.1.1.1.

When Distributed Firewall is used with Service Composer, firewall sections created by Service Composer contain an additional attribute in the XML called managedBy. You should not modify Service Composer firewall sections using Distributed Firewall REST APIs. If you do, you must synchronize firewall rules from Service Composer using the GET /api/2.0/services/policy/serviceprovider/firewall API.

Security

  • basic

Request Headers

If-Match string required

The Etag value from the response headers from a GET of the firewall configuration you want to modify.

Request Example (application/xml)

<section id="" name="" generationNumber="" timestamp="">
  <rule id="" disabled="" logged="">
    <name></name>
    <action></action>
    <appliedToList>
      <appliedTo>
        <name></name>
        <value></value>
        <type></type>
        <isValid></isValid>
      </appliedTo>
    </appliedToList>
    <sectionId></sectionId>
    <sources excluded="">
      <source>
        <name></name>
        <value></value>
        <type></type>
        <isValid></isValid>
      </source>
    </sources>
    <services>
      <service>
        <destinationPort></destinationPort>
        <protocol></protocol>
        <subProtocol></subProtocol>
      </service>
    </services>
  </rule>
</section>

DELETE /4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer2sections/{sectionId}

Deletes a L2 section and its content by ID

Security

  • basic

/4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer2sections/{sectionId}/rules

Working with distributed firewall rules in a layer 2 section.

POST /4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer2sections/{sectionId}/rules

Add rules to the specified layer 2 section in distributed firewall.

You add firewall rules at the global scope. You can then narrow down the scope (datacenter, cluster, distributed virtual port group, network, virtual machine, vNIC, or logical switch) at which you want to apply the rule. Firewall allows you to add multiple objects at the source and destination levels for each rule, which helps reduce the total number of firewall rules to be added. To add a identity based firewall rule, first create a security group based on Directory Group objects. Then create a firewall rule with the security group as the source or destination. Rules that direct traffic to a third part service are referred to as layer3 redirect rules, and are displayed in the layer3 redirect tab.

When Distributed Firewall is used with Service Composer, firewall rules created by Service Composer contain an additional attribute in the XML called managedBy.

Follow this procedure to add a rule:

  • Retrieve the configuration for the specified section.
  • Retrieve the Etag value from the response headers. Note: Each section contains its own Etag, generationNumber, and timestamp. When adding a new rule, you must use the Etag value of the firewall section to which you wish to add the rule.
  • Extract and modify the configuration from the response body as needed.
  • Set the If-Match header to the section Etag value, and submit the request.

Not all fields are required while sending the request. All the optional fields are safe to be ignored while sending the configuration to server. For example, if an IP set is referenced in the rule only IPSet and Type is needed in the Source/Destination objects and not Name and isValid tags.

When updating the firewall configuration:

  • IDs for new rules should be removed or set to zero.
  • If new rules have been sent in the request, the response will contain the system-generated IDs, which are assigned to these new entities.
  • appliedTo can be any valid firewall rule element.
  • action can be ALLOW, BLOCK, or REJECT. REJECT sends reject message for unaccepted packets; RST packets are sent for TCP connections and ICMP unreachable code packets are sent for UDP, ICMP, and other IP connections
  • source and destination can have an exclude flag. For example, if you add an exclude tag for 1.1.1.1 in the source parameter, the rule looks for traffic originating from all IPs other than 1.1.1.1.

Security

  • basic

Request Headers

If-Match string required

The Etag value from the response headers from a GET of the firewall configuration you want to modify.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="rule">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="action"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="notes"/>
        <xs:element name="appliedToList">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="appliedTo">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="sources">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="source">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isValid"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
            <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="excluded"/>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="destinations">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="destination">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isValid"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
            <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="excluded"/>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="services">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="service">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
      <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="disabled"/>
      <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="logged"/>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<rule disabled="" logged="">
  <name></name>
  <action></action>
  <notes></notes>
  <appliedToList>
    <appliedTo>
      <value></value>
      <type></type>
    </appliedTo>
  </appliedToList>
  <sources excluded="">
    <source>
      <name></name>
      <value></value>
      <type></type>
      <isValid></isValid>
    </source>
  </sources>
  <destinations excluded="">
    <destination>
      <name></name>
      <value></value>
      <type></type>
      <isValid></isValid>
    </destination>
  </destinations>
  <services>
    <service>
      <value></value>
    </service>
  </services>
</rule>

/4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer2sections/{sectionId}/rules/{ruleId}

Operations on L2 rules in sections identified by section Id and Rule Id

URI Parameters

ruleId string required

The ID of the rule beeing read, updated or deleted

GET /4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer2sections/{sectionId}/rules/{ruleId}

Read the configuration of a specific rule identified by rule Id

Security

  • basic

PUT /4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer2sections/{sectionId}/rules/{ruleId}

Update a distributed firewall rule in a layer 2 section.

  • Retrieve the configuration for the section that contains the rule you want to modify.
  • Retrieve the Etag value from the response headers. Note: This is the Etag value of the firewall section to which you want to add the rule. If you are keeping this rule in the same section, you must keep the same Etag number.
  • Extract and modify the rule configuration from the response body as needed.
  • Set the If-Match header to the section Etag value, and submit the request.

Not all fields are required while sending the request. All the optional fields are safe to be ignored while sending the configuration to server. For example, if an IP set is referenced in the rule only IPSet and Type is needed in the Source/Destination objects and not Name and isValid tags.

Security

  • basic

Request Headers

If-Match string required

The Etag value from the response headers from a GET of the firewall configuration you want to modify.

Request Example (application/xml)

<rule id="" disabled="" logged="">
  <name></name>
  <action></action>
  <notes></notes>
  <sources excluded="">
    <source>
      <value></value>
      <type></type>
      <isValid></isValid>
    </source>
  </sources>
  <destinations excluded="">
    <destination>
      <name></name>
      <value></value>
      <type></type>
      <isValid></isValid>
    </destination>
  </destinations>
  <services>
    <service>
      <name></name>
      <value></value>
      <type></type>
      <isValid></isValid>
    </service>
  </services>
  <appliedToList>
    <appliedTo>
      <name></name>
      <value></value>
      <type></type>
      <isValid></isValid>
    </appliedTo>
  </appliedToList>
</rule>

DELETE /4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer2sections/{sectionId}/rules/{ruleId}

Delete the specified distributed firewall rule.

Security

  • basic

Request Headers

If-Match string required

The Etag value from the response headers from a GET of the firewall configuration you want to modify.

/4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer3redirect/profiles

Service Insertion profiles that can be applied to layer3 redirect rules

GET /4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer3redirect/profiles

Retrieve the Service Insertion profiles

Security

  • basic

/4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer3redirectsections

Layer3 redirect sections and rules

POST /4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer3redirectsections

Add L3 redirect section

Security

  • basic

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="section">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="action"/>
        <xs:element name="appliedToList">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="appliedTo">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isValid"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="sectionId"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<section>
  <name></name>
  <action></action>
  <appliedToList>
    <appliedTo>
      <name></name>
      <value></value>
      <type></type>
      <isValid></isValid>
    </appliedTo>
  </appliedToList>
  <sectionId></sectionId>
</section>

/4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer3redirectsections/{section}

Layer3 redirect section

URI Parameters

section string required

Specify section by ID or name

GET /4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer3redirectsections/{section}

Get L3 redirect section configuration

Security

  • basic

PUT /4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer3redirectsections/{section}

Modify L3 Redirect section. You will need to get the Etag value out of the GET first. Then pass the modified version of the whole redirect section configuration in the GET body

Security

  • basic

Request Headers

If-Match string required

The Etag value from the response headers from a GET of the firewall configuration you want to modify.

Request Schema

<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="section">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="rule">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="action"/>
              <xs:element name="appliedToList">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="appliedTo">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="name"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="value"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="type"/>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="isValid"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="sectionId"/>
            </xs:sequence>
            <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="id"/>
            <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="disabled"/>
            <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="logged"/>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
      <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="id"/>
      <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="name"/>
      <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="generationNumber"/>
      <xs:attribute type="xs:string" name="timestamp"/>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Request Example (application/xml)

<section id="" name="" generationNumber="" timestamp="">
  <rule id="" disabled="" logged="">
    <name></name>
    <action></action>
    <appliedToList>
      <appliedTo>
        <name></name>
        <value></value>
        <type></type>
        <isValid></isValid>
      </appliedTo>
    </appliedToList>
    <sectionId></sectionId>
  </rule>
</section>

DELETE /4.0/firewall/globalroot-0/config/layer3redirectsections/{section}

Delete specified L3 redirect section

Security

  • basic

Security

  • basic
